A Tumba de Morkh Amhor é uma aventura clássica do cenário Tormenta e serviu como base para alguns pontos do cenário, como o Reino de Sambúrdia.

Outro destaque é a participação dos personagens Katabrok e Vladislav Tpish.

O autor da aventura é Rogério Saladino, um dos membros do Trio Tormenta.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Tomb of Morkh Amhor is a classic adventure scenario Storm and served as the basis for some scenic spots, such as the Kingdom of Sambúrdia.

Another highlight is the participation of the characters Katabrok and Vladislav Tpish.

The author of the adventure is Rogério Saladin, a member of the Trio Storm.

158092.name: A Cidade Perdida
158092.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perdidos no Deserto! A única esperança para a sobrevivência está em uma cidade em ruínas erguida nas areias. Comida, água e riquezas aguardam heróicos aventureiros dentro de uma antiga pirâmide governada por uma estranha raça de seres mascarados.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Lost in the Desert! The only hope for survival is in a ruined city built on the sands. Food, water and riches await heroic adventurers in an ancient pyramid ruled by a strange breed of masked beings.

User note: This is a conversion of B4: The Lost City to the Old Dragon system.

158093.description:
Body-building the Baron's way in Frankenstein's Bodies, a game in which players are surgeons competing to impress Frankenstein with the creations they make from the body parts available. Players have two laboratory benches on which to work and aim to collect body parts (cards) matched in terms of gender and serum color. The bodies that are the most complete and most matched gain bonus points, and the player with the highest total wins.

Body parts can be stolen from other players by using surgery cards, but at the risk of becoming infected. Master surgeons can be employed to prevent surgery and gain extra bonuses. Frankenstein's Bodies is a highly interactive game of competitive surgery.

The deck is totally language independent and with only 8 types of cards in play is the first of YAY Games '2 Turns to Learn' games.

In April 2015 'Frankenstein's Bodies' won the prestigious Griffie Award for Best Board Game 2015. The Griffie's are award by Scotland's longest running gaming and fantasy convention Conpulsion and is voted for by attendees.
158093.name: Frankenstein's Bodies
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Boardgame Interview Room: Frankenstein’s Bodies with Andrew Harman

158095.name: Horror em São Géridos
158095.description:
From publisher blurb:

Essa aventura foi escrita por Jeferson Kalderash que escreve em diversos blogs de RPG (Vila RPG, Forja, Paragons). Essa aventura foi disponibilizada no Paragons, mas no formato de post.

A única coisa que tivemos que fazer foi colocá-la dentro do layout que a Red Box disponibiliza-la para vocês.

Óbvio que conversamos com o Jeferson e ele gentilmente nos deu autorização para publicar a aventura no Homeless Dragon.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This adventure was written by Jeferson Kalderash who writes on various blogs RPG (RPG Vila, Forge, Paragons). This adventure was released in Paragons, but in the post format.

The only thing we had to do was put it in the layout that Red Box offers it to you.

Obviously talked with Jefferson and he kindly gave us permission to publish the adventure in Dragon Homeless.

158096.name: The Last Fajita
158096.description:
A family game for 2-4 players about becoming the head chef in the world famous "Burrito! Burrito!" restaurant.

The world famous Tex-Mex Restaurant “Burrito! Burrito!” is looking for a new head chef. As an up-and-coming chef, this is a huge opportunity for you. However, you are not alone in your quest to become world renowned.
The restaurant owners are running an open competition to find the right chef for the job, and you will have to compete with other chefs, for the position. The task is simple; be the most productive and resourceful chef to complete the last fajita and the job will be yours.

Chefs will compete to be the first to complete 5 finished fajitas. The first chef to fulfill their fifth fajita order is the winner.

158097.name: O Disco dos Três
158097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Essa aventura foi publicada originalmente na revista Dragão Brasil nº5 e foi a primeira aventura com continuação em outras edições.

O Disco dos Três é uma aventura clássica que com certeza trará diversão para quem nunca jogou e nostalgia para os que a jogaram nas páginas da revista.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This adventure was originally published in Dragon magazine Brazil # 5 and was the first adventure continued with other issues.

Disc Three is a classic adventure that will certainly bring fun for those who have never played and nostalgia for those who played in the pages of the magazine.

User note: This is a conversion of D&D - O Disco dos Três: Primeira Parte to the Old Dragon system.

boardgameimplementation: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
158098.description:
This was the first product of the Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition. It was originally titled only as Star Fleet Battles with the front box cover of the Star Fleet Battles (Designer's Edition) (2nd cover). It later was named to Star Fleet Battles Volume I.

The Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles was produced as a box set with counters, map, basic Ship System Display (SSD) sheets and a 96 page rulebook.

A separate "Rulebook Only" version with a blue 3-ring binder was also available for previous owners of Star Fleet Battles who had the counters, map and the basic SSD sheets. The rulebook was designed to be disassembled and put in a 3 ring binder. New rules could then be added to the binder and rule updates and expansions replaced existing pages.

Other expansions for the Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles included SSD books. Each of these expansions contained 48 revised and new SSD's which were larger then the basic SSD's and had charts for weapons and movement along with other locations to track Ship Systems.

This edition of the game was designated as Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition, and was the third edition of the Star Fleet Battles series.
...
Star Fleet Battles Volume I of the Commander's Edition included everything from the old boxed Star Fleet Battles (Designer's Edition), plus all the errata from the 3 expansions for Star Fleet Battles (Designer's Edition), and certain rules from them.

Re-implements:

Star Fleet Battles
Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition

158099.name: O Desfiladeiro Fantasma
158099.description:
From publisher blurb:

O que temos aqui não é exatamente uma aventura fechada - mas apenas um pequeno inconveniente para os heróis, que pode ser usado para prolongar uma saga maior. Este episódio deve ser acrescentado à aventura quando os personagens estiverem em viagem, atravessando uma cadeia de montanhas. Nada impede, contudo, que o grupo jogue O Desfiladeiro Fantasma como uma aventura curta, para uma única seção de jogo. Aventuras curtas costumam ser tao divertidas quanto as grandes odisséias.


Translation courtesy of Google:

What we have here is not exactly a closed adventure - but only a minor inconvenience for the heroes, which can be used to extend a greater saga. This episode should be added to the adventure when the characters are traveling across a mountain range. Nothing prevents, however, that the group play The Gorge Ghost as a short adventure for a single section of the game. Short adventures tend to be so much fun as the great odysseys.

User note: This is evidently a conversion of an article from Dragão Brasil (Issue 7) to the Old Dragon system.

boardgameintegration: Speed Cups
Speed Cups
158100.description:
Speed ​​Cups² can be played on its own with two players, but it can also serve as an expansion for Speed Cups, which then allows for play with up to six players.

In this game, each player receives a set of five plastic cups, each a different color; a deck of 24 cards is shuffled and placed face down in the center of the table next to the bell. One player flips over the top card, which depicts colored objects – trains, birds, cups, etc. – stacked vertically or horizontally, then everyone tries to recreate this colored sequence with her own set of cups. The first player to do slams the bell, revels in the soul-brightening "ding", then (if correct), claims the card. Someone then reveals the next card, and the players start shuffling cups once again.

In Speed ​​Cups² you don't only have to arrange your cups in horizontal and vertical stacks, but you also have to make different stacks!
158100.name: Speed Cups²

158101.name: Resgate em Threshold
158101.description:
From publisher blurb:

Essa aventura foi originalmente publicada nos anos 90 epela TSR e pouco depois foi publicada em português pela editora Abril.

Essa aventura faz parte de um livro chamado Karameikos - Terras de Aventuras, ambientado no cenário de Mystara.

Para aumentar a diversão e a interação dentro do jogo esse livro veio com dois tipos de acessórios, folhetos com mapas gerais dos locais que os jogadores visitarem e um CD com faixas que ajudam a ambientar a história.

Adaptamos a aventura para o sistema brasileiro Old Dragon, mas decidimos manter essas duas caracterisiticas “extras”, tanto os folhetos como o CD vocês poderão utilizá-los, se assim quiserem, a utilização não é obrigatória para poder jogar a aventura.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This adventure was originally published in the '90s epela TSR and shortly after was published in Portuguese by Editora Abril.

This adventure is part of a book called Karameikos - Lands of Adventure, set in the Mystara setting.

To increase the fun and interaction within the game that book came with two types of accessories, brochures with general maps of local players and visit a CD with tracks that help acclimatise the story.

We adapt the adventure for the Brazilian system Old Dragon, but decided to keep these two "extras"'s characteristic, both as CD booklets you can use them if they want to use is not mandatory in order to play the adventure.

User note: This is a conversion of Karameikos: Kingdom of Adventure to the Old Dragon system.

158102.name: Templo do Observador
158102.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mais uma aventura da saudosa Dragão Brasil adaptada para o Old Dragon, o Templo do Observador é uma aventura recomendada para 4 a 6 jogadores entre o 4º e 6º nível, mas que pode ser adaptada facilmente para uma dificuldade maior ou menor dependendo do grupo.

Essa aventura foi publicada originalmente na Dragão Brasil número 10.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Another adventure of wistful Dragon Brazil adapted to the Old Dragon, the Temple of the Observer is a recommended adventure for 4-6 players between the 4th and 6th level, but that can be easily adapted to a greater or lesser difficulty depending on the group.

This adventure was originally published in Dragon Brazil number 10.

User note: This is a conversion of an article from Dragão Brasil to the Old Dragon system.

158103.name: Garras, Presas e Asas
158103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Esta não é uma aventura normal. Pode colocar seu personagem costumeiro de lado - ou use-o, se quiser, mas será pior pra você! Este desafio não é para simples mortais, mas sim para as mais antigas criaturas sobre a face do mundo: dragões.

No final da aventura, no quadro “Heróis Dragões”, você encontrará instruções para transformar dragões em personagens jogadores. Cada jogador deve escolher para si uma cor de dragão (para esta aventura dragões brancos são altamente recomendados). Todos os personagens são jovens (dragões de “1º Nível”). Apesar disso, já mostram a grande inteligência e sabedoria que é deles por direito - se bem que com uma generosa dose de impetuosidade juvenil. Acabaram de ocupar seu primeiro covil e coletaram exatas 5.000 peças de ouro - tesouro suficiente para seu status atual.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This is not a normal adventure. Can put aside his usual character - or use it if you want, but it will be worse for you! This challenge is not for mere mortals, but for the most ancient creatures on the face of the world: dragons.

At the end of the adventure, under "Dragons Heroes", you will find instructions for turning dragons player characters. Each player must choose for themselves a color dragon (for this adventure are highly recommended white dragons). All characters are young (Dragons "Level 1"). Nevertheless, already show great intelligence and wisdom that is rightfully theirs - albeit with a generous dose of youthful impetuosity. Just hold her first lair and collected 5,000 pieces of gold spot - enough to treasure their current status.

User note: This is a conversion of an article from Dragão Brasil (Issue 12 - Mar 1996) to the Old Dragon system.

158104.name: A Maldição de Haddonfield
158104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Como das outras vezes encontramos uma aventura de Old Dragon nos blogs que frequentamos e pedimos a autorização do autor para colocá-la no layout da Red Box e postá-la no blog, já fizemos isso com uma aventura do Jeferson Kalderash e uma do blog Além da Imaginação, pois bem, encontramos no blog do Tio Nitro uma aventura para Old Dragon que ele mestrou no 21º Quero Jogar RPG, no Centro Cultural da UFMG (Belo Horizonte), dia 22 de Abril, 2012. Assim como os demais, entramos em contato com ele, que gentilmente permitiu que colocássemos e postássemos a aventura no Homeless Dragon.

Muito obirigado Tio Nitro !!


Translation courtesy of Google:

As at other times we find an adventure of the Old Dragon blogs we attend and ask the author's permission to put it on the layout of the Red Box and post it on the blog, we've done this with an adventure Jeferson Kalderash and Beyond Blog Imagination, as well, found the blog of Uncle Nitro an adventure to Old Dragon he mestrou at 21 I Play RPG at UFMG Cultural Center (Belo Horizonte), on April 22, 2012. Similar to the other, we get in contact with him, who kindly allowed us to place and postássemos adventure in Dragon Homeless.

Very obirigado Uncle Nitro!

158105.name: Ameaça Abissal
158105.description:
From publisher blurb:

Décima oitava aventura do blog Homeless Dragon, e continuando com a missão de trazer as aventuras da saudosa Dragão Brasil para o sistema Old Dragon.

Essa aventura foi publicada na revista Dragão Brasil número 15.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Eighteenth adventure blog Homeless Dragon, and continuing with the mission to bring the adventures of the Dragon Brazil nostalgic for Old Dragon system.

This adventure was published in Dragon magazine Brazil number 15.

User note: This is a conversion of an article from Dragão Brasil to the Old Dragon system.

158106.name: Dread Pirates
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
158106.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Dread Pirates (Fantasy)

If you're sailing the high seas or visiting a remote port, you may run across a band of ruthless pirates and their ship, the Dreadjammer! They rarely take prisoners and only have an eye for loot, so either fight for you life or hand over everything you have!

158107.name: Freebie Pack 2
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
158107.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

Want to know more? No problem!

Cast of Cards: Freebie Pack 2 gives you five free NPCs. These unique characters fit in with other Cast of Cards decks, but are not repeats! If you like what you see, you'll have an extra card ready to go for your next adventure.

158108.name: Orcs Galore: Battle-Hardened Extras
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
158108.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Orcs Galore: Battle-Hardened Extras (Fantasy)

Your basic orc is a great raider, but can be a pushover for experienced heroes. Battle-hardened orcs offer a great challenge—with better stats and higher skills, you can pick and choose what green-skinned baddies to throw against your overly confident adventurers!

158109.description:
Onward to Venus is based on the Doctor Grordbort graphic novels from writer/artist Greg Broadmore, with those books being a parody of sorts of the British Empire in the late 19th century, but instead of the race for Africa, we now have the exploitation of the Solar System, which is populated by various natives who resent the Earthling settlers.

The game Onward to Venus takes lots of artwork from the books and mixes it together to create an empire-building game set in the Solar System. The core rules are fairly straightforward, and a game can be completed in 90 minutes. The game is played over three turns; in each turn you whizz around the planets and moons claiming tiles. The tiles grant you cards, allow you to build a factory or mine, let you hunt strange beasts, or simply earn you some money. Other tiles allow you to attack other players or add to the crisis level on the planet/moon in question. You have to be careful with crisis tiles as if you let too many build up, bad stuff — Martian invasions, robot rebellions, space pirates, etc. — starts happening.
158109.name: Onward to Venus
boardgamepodcastepisode: clp043 – cubelove podcast – Martin Wallace Short Review Smackdown
Episode 11: Sherlock Holmes Drinks Pom While Flying a Star Destroyer to Venus
Episode 28 - Scythe Review
Episode 68- Grand Austria Hotel and Gaming Weaknesses
Essen 2014 - Martin Wallace
Planeta de Juegos 29 - Lo que nos espera en Essen 2014
The Long View: London

158110.description:
Extension to Piwne Imperium board game, named „Polskie browary i puby” (Beer Empire: Polish breweries and pubs). It is a deck of cards that contains 15 recipes from small and medium-sized regional and contract breweries. These breweries are located in Poland, and they create Polish „beer culture”.

In this deck you will also find 10 pub cards, that show real, special places on the Polish beer map where you can enjoy a good beer and spend time with your friends.

This extension also contains 30 new challenges and events cards, 12 of which were created in collaboration with those who supported the Beer Empire project at Wspieram.TO, a Polish crowdfunding platform.

With these cards added to Beer Empire, you can move in the realities of the Polish beer market, were you can meet interesting breweries or take the challenge for pubs, which are really places worth knowing.

Many of the event or challenges cards often refer to the situation we have seen in our home market - sometimes funny, sometimes serious, and sometimes unusual and unprecedented.

Add this expansion to Beer Empire and have fun, discovering trivia and elements of the "Polish Beer Market."
158110.name: Piwne Imperium: Polskie browary i puby

158111.description:
T.V. tie-in game for the BBC series Wallace & Gromit: World of Invention. "Start a space race and build a rocket with this cracking family game!"

A simple roll and move with 2.5D rocket models that slot together. The winner is the first player to collect all the pieces of their rocket. No tactical or strategic decisions with more random noise added by "Chance" cards that hinder, help, allow "take that" or defend from it.
158111.name: Wallace & Gromit Rocket Race

158112.name: Mutology
158112.description:
Mutology is a brand new strategy card game that transforms players into Mutologists, bioengineers obsessed with creating extraordinary creatures in their laboratories. Players will fire Radiation cards at their Specimens, and depending on what combinations of Radiation they're exposed to, Specimens will turn into one of two unique Mutants. Some Mutants are hyper aggressive, others have defense mechanisms, and some manipulate the way you or your opponent can play the game! You collect Research Points at the start of each turn for every Mutant you have in play, and the first player to 5 points wins.

Players mutate their Specimens by firing one of three kinds of Radiation, (Alpha, Beta, and Gamma Rays) at their Specimen cards. Each Specimen card comes with a unique ingredient list called "mutation requirements." Alone, Radiation cards give perks to the Specimen such as boosting their Power or Stability. Whenever a Specimen has met one of its mutation requirements, they would mutate into the corresponding Mutant card, which would wait outside of play until this moment.

Apart from Specimens and Mutants, player can build Devices like the Electric Coil and the Transmogrifier, or use Procedures like Brainstorm and Devolution. Lab Assistants like the Medic, Technician, and Researcher can lend their talents to you throughout the game as well. There are two zones of play in which cards can be placed: the Field Zone and the Lab Zone. These cards behave differently in each zone, so Mutology games always have a bit of tactical placement strategy involved.

158113.name: Torax
158113.description:
User Summary

Shoot down the thieving aliens in this simple “Defender” clone.

158115.name: Lewd and Obscene
158115.description:
The Dictionary is filled with words you may or may not have heard of. They are the words you used to look up on the internet or call each other when you were young. They are vulgar, sexual, positional, provocative, and just crazy. You will ask yourself, "do people actually do these things?" at least once every game.

But watch out, not every card in the Dictionary is Lewd and Obscene. Your creativity may get ahead of yourself. In that sense, you'll need to "get your mind out of the gutter."


Lewd and Obscene is an adult party game.

The game begins by picking a card from the Dictionary. The word is read aloud but the definition remains a mystery to everyone except the picker.

Players try their best to define the word. They write their made-up definition to the word on their "Definition Slip".

When all players are finished defining words, the slips are turned in, mixed up, and read aloud. After all definitions have been read, voting takes place.

When voting, tally points on the definition slip. If you convince a player to vote for your definition, you receive one (1) point. If you vote for the correct definition, you receive two (1) points. Once all the scores are collected, the next player picks a new card and starts all over.

Upon starting, you will all agree to a score to end on and once that has been reached, you will have your winner.

158116.description:
This mini expansion adds two main elements to the base game:

It adds a new "Power Die" that's rolled along with the standard dice. The "Power Die" can be chosen instead of one the other dice and it grants its own unique benefits.

It also adds an auction card and some cubes that are used to track an altered form of the "Auctions for Gold" from the base game.
158116.name: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game – Mini Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game

158117.name: Fantastic Adventure (Issue 2 - Autumn 1998)
rpgissuearticle: [Warhammer] Hexenjäger und Hinterwäldler oder die Geschichte von Teufelfeuer
158117.description:
Contents of the second issue include:
scenarios for Space Gothic, Warhammer Fantasy, AD&D;
material for Fearless (a miniatures game);
translation of Cyberpunk articles (Inmate Penal Corps, originally published in Interface vol. 1, #1-3);
an Ars Magica background;
a detailed look at the boardgame Blood Race;
two Grimtoothian traps;
and several product reviews/ introductions.

158118.name: PIIGS: European Economy in the New Era
158118.description:
Are you tired of seeing on TV the latest data of the Risk premium? Bored of hearing experts macroeconomic data retrospectively? Overwhelmed by high unemployment and social decline? In PIIGS players represent that pipe dream called "markets", whose purpose is to enrich themselves at the cost of eliminating the welfare state of the five countries that make up what some economists call PIIGS: Portugal, Italy, Ireland, Greece and Spain.

The game is played in several rounds, split shifts players who make reservations debt countries can buy and sell it later for a profit. On each turn a new debt issue comes into the world economic circuit, which can be purchased in successive turns, and the price will vary as dictated by the rating agencies and the European Central Bank.

The objective of the game is to buy the largest possible number of companies for which we have to get the maximum amount of money on successive shifts, buying and selling bonds of debt to debt reserves of the countries they last or the bankrupt companies. The player at the end of the game has more companies will be the winner.

158119.name: Christina Regina: The Queen's Path
158119.description:
Christina Regina - the Board Game is a game about politics and intrigues in 17th century Sweden where each player represents a faction with a hidden agenda. The end of their intrigues is the newly appointed queen Christina of Sweden and their means include persuasion, agitation, manipulation and even assassination. This is achieved by carefully steering the queen towards influence tiles bearing their faction colors and away from other influence tiles. At the same time, they must closely monitor the other players' actions to guess their agendas. But beware, if your own agenda is too obvious, you may yourself become the victim of your opponents' intrigues!

Game mechanisms include:

1. Tile laying: Tiles are laid at the start of the game and make every session unique.
2. Asymmetric scoring: There are no "good" or "bad" tiles but they all score differently for different players.
3. Hidden agendas: The players do not know how much the other players score until the very end.
4. Guessing game: Based on how players play, the other players may gain points by guessing their agendas (or lose points by guessing wrong).

Christina Regina is the third game in the Nova Suecia series.

158120.name: Vasa Regalis: The Maiden Voyage
158120.description:
Vasa Regalis: The Maiden Voyage is a game of the building and launching of the Vasa ship. The players take on the roles of shipyard leaders in 17th century Stockholm who have been given a royal order - the building and launching of the greatest battle ship ever seen. But to manage the delivery, they must procure goods, craft them into building material and use them to build the ship. At the same time, they must make a profit by secretly deciding how much to use for the ship and how much to keep for themselves. The players' total contribution determines the fate of the ship. If she is successful, the player who put most aside wins but if she is a disaster, only the player who put most into the ship will be spared the King's wrath. Each player must thus closely monitor the other players' strategies to determine whether to spend or to save. The victory conditions will not be clear until the game is over - but then it is too late to change the strategy.

Game mechanisms include:

1. Role-based: The players choose roles to perform actions, actions that give some players more benefits than others.
2. Economic balance: The players need to balance between the good types (wood, cloth, iron and sculptures) so that they always have something to work with.
3. Ambiguous victory conditions: The victory conditions depend on the sum of the players' actions and will not be clear until the game ends.
4. Guessing game: A player strategy is not visible to the other players and must be deduced from their actions.

Vasa Regalis is the fourth game in the Nova Suecia series.

158121.name: Dark Heresy Second Edition Core Rulebook
rpgissuearticle: Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie, 3 - Nova Castilla: l'Interrato
Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie, 4 - Il formicaio e le Alpe Spire
Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie. 1 - Scheda del pianeta e del formicaio di Nova Castilla
Fenksworld - Il Pianeta delle Grazie. 2 - Nova Castilla: la città vecchia (Vetus Castilla)
Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
158121.description:
From the publisher's website:
Dark Heresy Second Edition is a roleplaying game of danger, mystery, and brutal violence set in the decaying far future of Warhammer 40,000. Players take on the role of defenders of humanity and embark on hazardous adventures into the dark heart of the 41st Millennium. As an Acolyte of an Inquisitor, you’ll serve at the front line of a great and secret war to root out dangers that imperil all of humanity.

The 448-page, full-color Dark Heresy Second Edition Core Rulebook contains everything you and your friends will need to serve the Emperor in the Askellon Sector. Rules for character creation, combat, and adversaries are supplemented by informational source materials that will help Game Masters bring the Askellon Sector and its horrors to life. The Dark Heresy Second Edition Core Rulebook can be used to enjoy standalone adventures and ongoing campaigns in the grim future of the 41st millennium.

158122.description:
Migration is a game suitable for 2-4 players, in which each player takes the role of multiple anthropomorphic animals migrating to a new continent. Players take turns to place an animal token on the board, representing towns. Each new town must originate from the last town placed (with certain exceptions). Each animal token has a unique ability, introducing a high degree of strategy. The game is over when no player is able to make a legal move, and points are scored for each town on the board. The player with the highest score wins.

Migration: Book II – A Saga of Conflict includes both Book I and a new Book II. There are new mechanics since the Game Crafter version including: Age Cards, an optional drafting mechanism, a modular board, additional terrain modifiers, and six new explorer types.
158122.name: Migration: Book II – A Saga of Conflict
boardgameaccessory: Migration: Book II – Linen Ocean Map
Migration: Book II – Token Stickers

158123.name: Aperture
158123.description:
From publisher blurb:

APERTURE!

They say as some doors open, other open. In Aperture's case, infinite doorways open for him to draw power from as he stands tethered to this one. A living portal trapped in a containment suit, he's ready to send your heroes on the ride of their lives!

158124.name: April 2014 Free Monster of the Month: Nannerpod
158124.description:
From publisher blurb:

"What appears to be a giant half-eaten banana springs to life in a flurry of excited movement. Its single unblinking eye shows neither fear, nor mercy."

From the pages of Dungeonous Octopus: Bananas!

It's Nannerpod!

Now you can get this pancake-crazed banana monster for free.

158125.name: Sword Master
158125.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready Your Blade!

With the Sword Master, a new 20-level class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll be ready to face whatever dangers lay in the dark places and deep dungeons of the world! A blade of steel and a tempered heart are all you need to take on the world.

Sword Master also includes optional rules for use with Labyrinth Lord that will give new combat options to dwarves, elves, fighters, halflings and thieves! A touch of swashbuckling action comes to almost every class that wields a blade with this new supplement!

158126.name: Sectors Seven, Eleven, Twelve, & Fourteen
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
158126.description:
From publisher blurb:

There’s more to the Ephemeris universe than just “Colonized Space.” Now you can get a chance to explore those sectors where the six species are only just starting to colonize, or even where none of them have been before.

The EEG: Sectors 7, 11, 12, & 14 continues to explore the space between the colonized sectors of the Ephmeris RPG.

158127.description:
Kickstarter-exclusive add-on.

Ocean map to enhance the nautical theme of Migration. During play, this map is used to help align the island plates and provide an attractive backdrop.

The map will be printed on linen and treated for protection. It will have the Migration logo and the Hexagonal Compass from Book I.
boardgameaccessory: Migration: Book II – A Saga of Conflict
158127.name: Migration: Book II – Linen Ocean Map

158128.description:
120 high resolution 1" stickers. Kickstarter add-on.

Optional stickers for the tokens featuring the illustrations (the tokens come with screen-printed symbols).

The background colors will match the color of the team.
boardgameaccessory: Migration: Book II – A Saga of Conflict
158128.name: Migration: Book II – Token Stickers

158129.description: Critical Extraction adds MERCS from the USCR faction to MERCS: Recon. Included are five USCR MERCS and their corresponding player boards and special rules. In addition, the mission pack contains new missions and a new tile.
158129.name: MERCS: Recon – Critical Extraction

boardgameintegration: Tanto Cuore
Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House
Tanto Cuore: Romantic Vacation
Tanto Cuore
Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House
Tanto Cuore: Romantic Vacation
158130.description:
Do you enjoy brats, burgers and beers? So do the beautiful, adorable and sexy maids of Tanto Cuore. They came to your chambers, they expanded your house, and they even made Master take them on vacation! Now what mischief are they getting into? Oktoberfest Edition will take your favorite art, gameplay and girls and give it a delightfully fall feel.

Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest is a standalone expansion to Tanto Cuore. Able to be played alone or with the previous three sets, it will feature all new artwork, gameplay and a full set of delightful maids for you to love!

Tanto Cuore is a Japanese deck-building card game. The player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.
158130.name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest
boardgameexpansion: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Gina Kersten Promo Card

158131.name: Mysterious Creatures
158131.description: Mysterious Creatures was created to engage player's curiosity in the mysteries of nature that exist across the world. The game takes each player on an adventure/race across the globe in search of their creature's evidence cards. The first player to collect all 3 evidence cards and make it back to their creature's country of origin wins! Along the way players will learn geography, country flags and multiple creatures such as Big Foot.

158132.description:
A roll and move elimination game for children starring The Gunge Gang - 4 monsters called Sticky Icky (Yellow), Scumbag (red), Crud (blue) and Yuck (green).

Each player takes charge of a team of 3 identical monsters. Players turns rolling the dice and moving in the swamp, a circular path on the board. The object is to land on the same space of an opponent's monster, which removes them from the game.

Double Cards allowed players to double their roll.

The last player with monsters left on the board wins.
158132.name: The Gunge Game

158133.name: Γίνε Ο Πρωθυπουργός
158133.description:
The game 'Become the prime minister' gets you in the battle of politics! You have to propose innovative and convincing ideas for society problems, so that you gain good evaluation numbers!

Moreover you have to keep good relationships with your rivals... Tactics and politics are closely related.

Every candidate moves using a dice and takes the corresponding card. He reads the problem, and starts setting up arguments and concluding to a solution for the problem. As soon as he finishes, everybody evaluate his speech with their available card numbers (positive, neutral or even negative). You don't want negative evaluations in your hands at the end of the game...

The player with the greatest sum of evaluations after 3 rounds wins the game.

158134.name: Κόντρα 10
158134.description:
It's a pleasant and joyful party - trivia game in which one player or team of players asks the other for 10 answers. For example 10 movies of Ppielberg, 10 fruits with one kernel, or 10 tints of blue.

Each answer (of the 10) depending on its difficulty gives the player, or team points (from 1 to 5). The player or team with the most points at the end of the game is the winning one.

158135.name: The Android Underlords
158135.description:
From the back of the book:

An all-new adventure for METAMORPHOSIS ALPHA, the first sci-fi RPG created by James M. Ward in 1976!

The Knower of All Things has been kidnapped! Mysterious agents have abducted the village shaman in the dead of night, leaving a hideous trail in their wake. Now it is up to the brave and strongest members of the tribe to rescue the shaman before he falls victim to his captors' nefarious plans. Before their journey is through, the village heroes will find themselves in an undreamt-of place, battling faceless foes. Is your mutant up to the challenge?

This adventure module is designed for METAMORPHOSIS ALPHA first edition, as originally published in 1976 and re-published by Goodman Games in 2014.

158136.name: The Nahmurg Wastes
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158136.description:
subtitle
A Post-Apocalyptic Campaign Setting

user summary:
This campaign sourcebook for the Saga Rule-light Universal Roleplaying System describes a near-future, post-apocalyptic setting similar to the setting of the Fallout series of video games.

The details of the setting include: inhabitants (and playable races), languages, conflicts, equipment, food, land, religion, trade, organizations, famous figures and a bestiary.

Much of the content is descriptive text only and could easily be adapted to another rules system.

158137.name: Λίστες
158137.description:
Lists is a very pleasant trivia game!

Every player has to place in the right order some answers in the card that is being played.

An example could be chronological order of some events, or American presidents, right order from the longest river to the shortest one, right order from the movie with the most Oscars to the one with the least. The answers are given. You'll have just to place them in the right order.

Depending on your right answers in the row, you move along the board till the finish line!

158138.name: Chronicles of Magnamund
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158138.description:
subtitle
A High-Fantasy Campaign Setting

fromThe inspiration for this setting:
Chronicles of Magnamund is a fantasy campaign setting for Saga based on the world Magnamund, a setting made popular by the Lone Wolf series. Any fan of fantasy who grew up in the 80s must certainly know about the Lone Wolf Lone Wolf gamebooks. They definitely helped shape my childhood. Lone Wolf is the longest running and most popular gamebook series ever made. Currently (2010), there is a Lone Wolf RPG being produced, but the roleplaying game and its system, much like the series and the world it's set in, has many shortcomings.

fromAnd the setting itself:
…this adaptation of Magnamund has a number of important changes and improvements. A few new races have been added to the world for diversity, and the races that have been borrowed from Joe Dever's books are less rigid and polarized: some Dwarves are miners, true, but some are also scientists and wizards, and they don't all wear beards; some Giaks are powerful warriors, but many others are mathematicians, priests, diplomats, and thieves. Also, no race is inherently good or evil. Individual members of races perform good deeds and act evilly, while others remain neutral in most cases, and walk the fine line of ethics that makes them neither good nor bad. There are also new religions in the following pages, unlike the Lone Wolf novels, which feature one religion with two
ideologically opposed gods.

Weapons, armor, magic and psionics have all been adapted to fit the Saga core rules, making combat much more realistic and deadly than in the Lone Wolf books. Professions are also less racially-restricted. Giaks traveling to Dessi can become magicians if they enroll and learn the proper skills, and lizardmen of the swamps who travel to Sommerlund can become Kai lords if they enlist at the Kai monastery.

Countries and regions have also been diversified and made more realistic. There is a huge variety of political structures, and not all of the nations and people of Magnamund are civilized. There are still indigenous “primitive” cultures characters can play as, ally with or against, visit, or ignore entirely. These peoples are brutally oppressed by the civilized nation states that want to conquer, destroy, convert, or enslave them, providing a wholly new socio-political element that the original Magnamund couldn't
dream of.

158139.name: Braythmar: of Resistance to Empire in an Age of Bronze
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158139.description:
subtitle
a Bronze Age High-Fantasy Campaign Setting for use with SAGA & other roleplaying systems

fromWhy another high-fantasy campaign setting?:
There are so many high-fantasy campaign settings and worlds to choose from when beginning a roleplaying campaign, it does seem a little excessive to write another. However, despite the universality of this genre, fantasy gaming and literature are overrun by awful stereotypes, idiotic conventions, and otherwise stupid trappings that ruin what should be an infinitely refreshing and renewable territory.

Everyone who has played a fantasy RPG or who has experienced some kind of fantasy media knows these trappings I'm talking about… Elves are all nimble archers who live in the woods; Orcs are all brutish, savage warriors with the intellect of a pea; Dwarves drink mead and beer by the gallon, have long beards, speak in ill-conceived Scottish accents, shoot blunderbusses, wield axes, and mine the depths of the planet; Trolls are stupid, axe-throwing beasts; Goblins are wicked, snickering, child-like tinkerers, who all love to build machines; Humans are the most widespread race, and they have such a diversity of skills and talents that they get no bonuses or penalties; fantasy worlds must contain Elves, Orcs, Dwarves, Trolls, Goblins, and Elves; all societies in fantasy worlds are perfect reflections of the European middle ages, and monarchy is a desirable and fun governmental system to live under...

These conventions go on and on, each stupider than the last. My purpose in writing another fantasy campaign setting is to completely abolish all of the these stereotypes and to create a believable, complex fantasy world. It is also my intent to create a fantasy setting based on my own anarchist politics. To some degree, I've tried to do this before…. However, I've never really succeeded in creating a world-scenario that encapsulates my politics. Hopefully, Braythmar does so.

158140.name: The Hyborian Age
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158140.description:
subtitle
a Low-Fantasy Campaign Setting in the World of Conan

fromA Short Introduction:
This campaign setting is based on the works of Robert E. Howard, creator of Conan the Barbarian, Kull the Conqueror, and numerous other memorable characters of the mythical Hyborian Age and the shrouded times of ancient past. Fans of Conan and other related stories will already be familiar with much of this material. Those who aren't Conan fans will find it all very new, so following below is a short and largely inadequate description of this campaign setting.

The Hyborian Age is a pseudo-historical low-fantasy world that partially resembles the ancient and pre-ancient history of our world. Many of the societies in Howard's mythos are based partly or entirely on civilizations and non-civilized societies that have existed in the past. These cultures range in flavor and technological level from pre-historic Paleolithic to the Middle Eastern, the Classical to the Medieval.

Humans are the only playable race in Hyboria, although there are many fantastic and real-world creatures to be found as well. There are no dwarves, elves, orcs, or halflings here. Magic is present, but it is radically different than in most fantasy settings. It is subtle, ritualistic, and infinitely more powerful than in D&D and other common RPG systems. It fits perfectly with the magic system detailed in the Saga Core Rulebook.

Another distinguishing feature of Howard's world is its deadliness and brutality. Hyboria is a kill or be killed, conquer or submit kind of place. The average lifespan for most people is around 30 years; grey hair is considered a sign of great strength, resilience, and wisdom, as death comes early to most.

One final thing players should be aware of is the crossover between Howard's world and Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos. The mythology of the Elder Gods and Great Old Ones occasionally made its way into Hyboria, and I wholeheartedly endorse this admixture. The demon-gods of the Cthulhu mythos compliment the demon-gods of Conan's world brilliantly, and campaigns in the Hyborian Age are sure to encounter some kind of insanity-inspiring, horrific being at some point. Players and Narrators should familiarize themselves with this mythology if they are not already versed in it.

158141.name: Berserker
158141.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the fury of the Northmen release us, O Lord!

With the Berserker, a new 20-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll bring the fury of the north to your fantasy gaming table! Terrify your enemies with unbridled rage and unique abilities!

158142.name: The Arcane Archer
158142.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arcane Archer
Those who seek to perfectly combine bow and magic pursue the path of the arcane archer. Arcane archers are masters of ranged combat, as they possess the ability to strike targets with unerring accuracy and can imbue their arrows with powerful spells. Arrows fired by arcane archers carry spells, fly at weird and uncanny angles to strike foes around corners, and can pass through solid objects to hit enemies. At the height of their power, arcane archers can fell even the most powerful foes with a single, deadly shot.

Prestige Class: Arcane Archer.
Build Classes: Magus, Ranger, Wizard.

What is a Prestige Archetype?

A prestige archetype is a prestige class turned into a normal 20-level class, similar to an archetype or alternate class.

The goal when making these prestige archetypes has been to capture the flavor of the prestige class rather than to make an exact copy of how it would normally be. Attack bonuses, hit dice, class skills, spells, and class features have been unified and spread evenly over levels. This means that most prestige archetypes have their prestige abilities spread over the entire 20 level spread. Unlike how prestige classes normally work, these archetypes have a few complete class abilities rather than many abilities limited to a low level. In some cases, you get the choice of one of several class abilities rather than stymied versions of all the abilities.

A prestige archetype generally has elements of one or more regular character classes, to represent how prestige prerequisites were met and character development after the prestige class has ended. Sometimes there is more than one class that naturally leads itself to a particular prestige class, which can lead to several different prestige archetypes for different combinations. A few are not built on a regular class, instead expanding the idea behind the prestige class to a full 20 levels.

158143.name: Arcanum of Steamworks & Magic Obscura
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158143.description:
subtitle
a dark urban, high-fantasy, steampunk Campaign Setting

fromInspirations for this Campaign Setting:
The tome that you now in your hands, dearest reader, is an agglomeration of many other fine works. Indeed, this is a pastiche in the truest sense, a literary medley with ingredients gathered from far and wide. As the title suggests, Arcanum is a setting of dark urban intrigue, high-fantasy exploration and magic, as well as forray into the grease-smeared, gear- powered world of Steampunk. Let us explore the inspirations for each of these elements below.

The first and most obvious foundation for this setting is the PC game of the same name. Those who booted up their Babbage Engines and played Arcanum will most certainly recognize a great deal of material herein. However, the author has taken many artistic liberties, and much of the information below is new or altered. Therefore, those who have played Arcanum the game are highly encouraged to read Arcanum the campaign setting in order to familiarize themselves with the world presented herein.

One of the most delightful aspects of Steampunk, in this author's opinion, is the atmosphere of gloomy, repressive, urban nightmare. The original Arcanum failed to provide this. Another series of steampunk games—the Thief series—presented this element in masterfully crafted form. The Urban areas in this campaign setting are all highly reminiscent of "The City" of the Thief series. Further, all of the factions and organizations found within those games appear in this setting, including the Pagans, the Order of the Hammer (aka: the Hammerites), and The Keepers.

Another source of the Dark Urban flavor is the Neverwhere franchise by a Mr. Neil Gaiman. Players who have read the novel, the picture periodicals, or who have seen the original moving picture will recognize familiar territory here. That is to say, within the Great Cities of the world of Arcanum, one may delve down deep and discover entire subterranean cities and civilizations undreamed of above.

158144.name: Neverwhere
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158144.description:
subtitle
A Dark Urban Campaign Setting

fromInspiration for this Campaign Setting:
The Neverwhere campaign setting is inspired in its entirety by the novel Neverwhere. The novel, in turn, was written as a follow-up to the amazing though horribly filmed BBC series of the same name. Both the novel and the BBC series are the brainchildren of acclaimed English author Neil Gaiman. Reading the novel and/or watching the series is not necessary for Neverwhere players, as this campaign setting supplement includes all the information gleaned from those sources. However, to internalize and understand the atmosphere that this campaign setting strives for, familiarizing oneself with the source material can be most helpful.

Those who are already well-versed in the novel or series will recognize a great deal of information herein. The discerning reader will also note that much of the information within this supplement is either extrapolated from the source material or it is entirely original. Neil Gaiman hinted at a world of rich mythos in creating Neverwhere, and it would be a shame not to expand upon his initial framework.

158145.name: Magic: the Gathering
rpg: Saga: A Rules-light Universal Roleplaying System
158145.description:
from the Introduction:
To most seasoned roleplayers, Magic: the Gathering is a game that needs no introducing. It is a legend in its own right, beloved of nerds, cherished by dorks. Even those who have never played Magic: the Gathering are most likely familiar with it to some extent due to its popularity as a cultural meme. Honestly, it's pretty unlikely that you're reading this if you're not into the game or the mythos of M:tG.

However, despite the tremendous popularity and near-universal presence of Magic the world over, for some reason, the game has never been adapted into a Roleplaying Game or World Setting. The campaign setting supplement you're now reading is proof that I find this fact shocking, ridiculous, and in need of fixing.

from A Little About This Campaign Setting:
In the rare event that you're unfamiliar with Magic: the Gathering, this campaign setting needs some explaining. The worlds (yes, plural) of the Magic: the Gathering multiverse are notably and primarily High Fantasy in flavor, with sprinklings of Steampunk gadgetry, Gothic Horror beasties, and Samurai and Ninja jidaigeki. Classical Chinese Elementalism governs everything in the Magic multiverse in the form of five symbols (fire, water, etc.). Each symbol governs and influences multiple spheres of life, the universe, and everything, and are crucial to the atmosphere of Magic: the Gathering.

158146.name: Os Novos Heróis
158146.description:
From publisher blurb:

Essa é a primeira aventura de autoria do blog Homeless Dragon. Tivemos muita dificuldade para definir essa aventura, tínhamos várias idéias na cabeça, sessões de jogos que fizemos, filmes que assistimos, video game que jogamos, enfim, eram várias ideias e definir por essa aventura de Ragnarok Online foi algo ... diferente.

Como dissemos nos ebooks com ambientações do Ragnarok Online, jogamos por quase seis anos esse jogo e pelo menos metade dele foi dedicado ao RP, sendo assim tínhamos uma “campanha” dentro do Ragnarok Online, com nossos personagens e guildas, criamos NPCs, tudo isso usando o rico cenário do Ragnarok Onlline.

Essa decisão puxou uma outra. Essa aventura não seria lançada sob o selo Homeless Dragon (HD), teríamos que criar uma coisa nova, pois essa aventura é apenas o início da nossa campanha online - pronto, nasceu o segundo selo de aventuras do blog, o Ragnarok Online (RO) que contará a saga dos nossos personagens por Rune Midgard, adaptados para o bom e Velho Dragão.

Essa será a primeira de uma série de aventuras que poderão ser jogadas de maneira interligada, levando os heróis a glória e salvando Rune Midgard do mal.


Translation courtesy of Google:

This is the first adventure written by the blog Homeless Dragon . We had a lot of trouble to set this adventure, we had several ideas in mind , gaming sessions we did , we watch movies , and video games we play finally , and several ideas were set for this adventure Ragnarok Online was something ... different.

As we said in ebooks with ambientations Ragnarok Online , played for nearly six years this game and at least half of it was devoted to the RP , so we had a "campaign " within the Ragnarok Online with our characters and guilds , create NPCs , all using the rich scenery of Ragnarok onlline .

This decision drew another . This adventure would not be released under the label Homeless Dragon ( HD ) , we would have to create a new thing , because this adventure is just the beginning of our campaign online - ready, was born the second seal adventure blog , Ragnarok Online ( RO ) that will tell the saga of our characters by Rune Midgard , adapted to the good old Dragon .

This will be the first in a series of adventures that can be played in an interconnected way , taking the heroes and saving glory Rune Midgard evil .

158147.name: A Fome Amarela
158147.description:
From publisher blurb:

“O portal se abriu. Ylhammak, A Morte Amarela, sentado em seu trono de ossos, exala fome e caos. Aqueles que o destino colocar em seu caminho podem se tornar suas primeiras presas em eras... Ou podem se tornar aqueles que cortarão sua língua e furarão seu olho.”

Nesta aventura os personagens dos jogadores se encontrarão numa verdadeira masmorra – tanto uma prisão quanto um perigoso labirinto repleto de monstros e armadilhas – e confrontarão o culto de uma divindade chtulhiana – e até mesmo a própria divindade. Inspirada num conto de Edgar Allan Poe intitulado “A máscara da morte rubra”, esta aventura é ideal para mestres que desejem incluir um deus antigo e seus asseclas em sua campanha, e oferece uma oportunidade para os aventureiros, mesmo em um nível baixo, ficarem famosos por mutilar a divindade. É claro que qualquer mestre sabe que isso será muito ruim para os aventureiros quando eles tiverem de resistir à vingança de um Grande Antigo!


Translation courtesy of Google:

"The portal opened. Ylhammak, The Yellow Death, seated on his throne of bones, exudes famine and chaos. Those that fate put in your path can become trapped in his early ages ... Or can become those who will stick her tongue and cut his eye. "

In this adventure the player characters find themselves in a real dungeon - as much a prison as a dangerous maze full of monsters and traps - and confront the worship of a deity chtulhiana - and even divinity itself. Inspired by a short story by Edgar Allan Poe entitled "The mask of crimson death", this adventure is ideal for teachers who wish to include an ancient god and his minions in his campaign, and provides an opportunity for the adventurous, even at a low level, become notorious for mutilating the deity. Of course, any teacher knows that this will be very bad for the adventurers when they have to resist the revenge of a Grand Old!

158148.name: A Casa de Diversões de Ellusya
158148.description:
From publisher blurb:

Escondida na parte mais pobre das docas de Malpetrim, a Casa de Diversões de Ellusya é estabelecida em uma ampla casa de três andares. Apenas a pequena tabuleta pendurada na porta avisa aos passantes da sua função. Durante o dia, o local permanece fechado, mas aqueles que por ali passam podem ouvir ocasionais risadas femininas e um ou outro palavrão em élfico ou anão sendo exprimido no interior. Enquanto há claridade, só é permitida a entrada para aqueles convidados pela dona do estabelecimento.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Hidden in the poorest part of the docks Malpetrim, the Fun House of Ellusya is established in an extensive three-story house. Only a small sign hanging on the door to warn passersby of their function. During the day, the venue remains closed, but those who pass there can hear occasional female laughter and an occasional curse in Elvish or dwarf being expressed within. While there is clarity, is allowed entry to those invited by the owner of the establishment.

158149.name: Orcs Galore: Wild Cards
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
158149.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Orcs Galore: Wild Cards (Fantasy)

Orcs: they're big, they're dumb, they're angry…usually. Even a race of brutes can produce particularly terrible, ambitious and competent individuals now and again, and Orcs Galore: Wild Cards offers 17 orc Wild Cards for your Savage Worlds game! The player characters should never turn their backs on these big green baddies!

158150.name: Orcs Galore: Extras
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
158150.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

'About Cast of Cards: Orcs Galore: Extras (Fantasy)

They're everywhere! Orcs are the ubiquitous baddies of almost any fantasy setting, and rightly so. These big, angry brutes will attack on sight and don't take prisoners. This Cast of Cards deck gives you 17 different orc units, from warriors to war bears!

158151.name: Thirst for Power
158151.description:
Thirst for Power from Nexus Games is a strategy and resource management game in which players are governors of regions and compete to be the first to provide for their citizens' energy needs.

The objective is to be the first player to meet the region's energy goal without exceeding its environmental impact limit. In the game, you will find that energy production, water consumption, and climate change are tightly intertwined. We call this the Nexus of Energy, Water, and Climate. This nexus makes it hard to get what you want and requires making trade-offs to win.

As governor, you will accumulate energy sources to provide for the transportation and electricity needs of your citizens. You will have a wide range of energy sources to choose from, both hydrocarbon-based and renewable. But, watch out! Every kind of energy source requires water and has an environmental impact on climate, land, water or living things. You will have limited water resources and a cap on your environmental impact, making it challenging to reach your energy goal. Energy sources like coal and oil will produce a lot of energy, but also use up a lot of water and have a big environmental impact. Renewable sources use less water and have lower environmental impact, but generate much less energy.

ACTION cards (TECHNOLOGY, POLICY, AND CLIMATE IMPACT) bring in real-world developments that change the course of the game and force players to quickly adapt their strategy. Buying technology gives you an advantage, while implementing policies can set your opponent back, and climate impacts wreak havoc on everyone. Strategy is critical along with negotiating trades throughout the game. Getting the right mix of energy sources and technology boosts for your region can be easier with negotiations and trades than taking your chances drawing from the deck.

158152.description: 1919: The Noble Experiment is a complex card game for up to four people (yes, you can have a lot of fun with just two!). A match typically takes around 45 minutes. The goal of the game is to collect as much Prestige points as possible, which is achieved by delivering contraband whisky to the city's pubs. To do so you need to perform a number of actions starting with buying ingredients at the local market, distilling whisky from them, bottling your whisky as well as finding and hiring a driver to pick up your order. Other players can disrupt your plans and gain the advantage, giving them the victory. That’s why you need to be ready for anything, including being punished by a law-abiding mayor that will confiscate our wares. Unless we get lucky and have a chance to bribe him first….
158152.name: 1919: The Noble Experiment

158153.name: Fanpiro (2nd Edition)
158153.description:
From the back cover (in Spanish the original)

Bienvenido a FANPIRO, un juego en el que haber leído demasiados cómics, jugado a la consola más de la cuenta, visto demasiadas películas, participado en innumerables campañas de rol... puede salvarte la vida.

(English)

Welcome to FANPIRO, a game in which to have read too many comics, played the console too much, seen too many movies, informed in innumerable campaigns of role ... it can save the life.

----

In the Fanhunter universe a lunatic tyrant called Alejo I has forbidden almost all the entertainment options except the Philip. K. Dick works and he governs almost Europe with a mix of military dictatorship and populism. The cinema fans, the music fans, the videogamers, the comic fans, rol fans, and whatever kind of subculture fans are hounded and they have organized a Resistance that is against the invasor with the knowledgements obtained from his favourite works.

Some of them have special powers from the Barrabas virus and move by the night, not like vampires, like Fanpiros.

158154.name: Player's guide 1: Camorrilla e independientes
158154.description:
From the back cover (in Spanish the original)

En este suplemento, imprescindible para todos los aficionados, encontrarás aquello que echaste de falta en el juego. Nuevas Habilidades, nuevas profesiones, nuevos Problemas, nuevos Beneficios... todo es nuevo, menos los chistes. Con información sobre los cubles independientes, las peñas, reglas de artes marciales y otras paridas, nuevas Disciplinas y dolor, mucho dolor

(English)

In this supplement, indispensable for all the fans, you will find that one that you threw of lack in the game. New Skills, new professions, new Problems, new Benefits ... all is new, except jokes. With information about the independent cubles, the gangs, rules of martial arts and other absurdities, new Disciplines and pain, very much pain.

158155.name: Player's guide 2: Sabadete
158155.description:
From the back cover (in Spanish the original)

La sombra del SABADETE es alargada
"Arriesgando su vida, hemos introducido a un temeroso fanpiro en la facción más cruel de todas las que pueblan la noche, y con los informes semanales que nos iba enviando hemos confeccionado esta segunda guía del jugador, en la que desvelamos los entresijos del SABADETE".

(English)

The shade of the SABADETE is lengthened
"Risking his life, we have introduced a fearful fanpiro in the cruellest faction of all those who populate the night, and with thet informs weekly that he was sending us we have made this second guide of the player, in whom we reveal the mesenteries of the SABADETE ".

158156.name: Night Raid
158156.description:
User Summary

In Night Raid, the player controls a single gun placed in a turret at the middle and bottom of the screen. The gun can pivot to aim at the sky, where paratroopers are constantly being dropped from planes.
A level involves defending the surface from these paratroopers by shooting them, their parachutes, and the planes, hoping to stop more than 2 from making a safe landing. Debris from a shot plane will kill landed troops and ammo is unlimited (though each shot costs 1 point).

158157.name: Myriad Song
158157.description:
From publisher blurb:

MYRIAD SONG is a tribute to the New Wave of Science Fiction... to progressive rock and sci-fi comic books... to Rush, King Crimson, and Hawkwind ... to Incal, Valerian, and Rourke... to Heavy Metal, Dune and Fifth Element. Journey to unknown spheres both real and imagined, because matter is merely atoms vibrating with frequency, and the difference between harmony and discord can be either an eyelash's breadth or a distant star. Converse with strange aliens, fall in with dangerous cults, stand on impossible skyscrapers that preside over undiscovered landscapes. The dangers are great, but the rewards are even greater.

In the darkness of ages past, our universe was visited by aliens strange and unknowable. They enslaved hundreds of people and they conquered thousands of worlds. For untold generations, the Myriad people served them, and worlds were stripped of all resources, and left barren and dead. And then, a century ago, the Syndics were gone. Did they retreat to another universe? Are they hiding on undiscovered worlds, in radio silence? Interplanetary factions spread their philosophy from place to place. The Solar Creed offers the people free energy . . . at the price of their freedom and liberty. The technologists of the Concord push forward with their new science, for better or for ill. What mysterious dangers lurk in the unknown voids of space?

A complete game in one volume, MYRIAD SONG is a science-fiction adventure where you will travel in the strange legacy of an alien empire. Discover primitive worlds with savage monsters . . . high-tech stations of amazing technology . . . derelict planets where people scrounge out a living among the ruins . . . and places far stranger. You will find lost treasures . . . and you will find horrors best forgotten. The risks are great, but the rewards are greater.

Built using the Cardinal rules engine (as seen in IRONCLAW, NOGGLE STONES, and USAGI YOJIMBO RPG), our game lets you build your character to be as straightforward or as complex as you like. Play a no-nonsense adventurer ready for anything, or play a master specialist who has no equal in their field. Play an ordinary human thrust into extra-ordinary circumstances, or play a fantastic alien or machine, made from unknown science and with powers and abilities far beyond our normal space. Work with exotic alien materials to build savage and strange weapons, or use advanced technology to make cybernetic enhancements to make what you need, when you need it. Bluff your way past the secret police, or rob some petty lord of their ill-gotten riches, or fly a spaceship to vistas beyond any known horizon.

Lavishly illustrated in full color from some of the top talents working in science fiction, our game brings the worlds of your vivid imagination to you, and lets you make your story. Are you ready to heed the clarion call of the alien spheres, the music that is the MYRIAD SONG?

158158.name: The Chamber
158158.description:
From the introduction:

The Chamber is an emotional manipulation game about four broken people fighting the Walls, the Demon, the Eye, and each other.

The Chamber is a game for exactly four players, called subjects, plus one person who takes on the role of an Observer. The Chamber takes about 3-4 hours to play.

158159.description: Zombicide’s Compendium #1 is a 92-page book entirely devoted to your favorite game! Inside, you’ll find updated versions of all the official Campaigns and Missions published for Season 1, as well as brand new Missions, a precious Designer’s Note, and an exclusive Campaign!
158159.name: Zombicide Compendium 1
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s

158161.name: Bad Family
158161.description:
from The Pitch:
Do you like animated sit-coms like The Simpsons or Family Guy?

Do you like stories about dysfunctional families, like The Royal Tennenbaums, or Modern Family, Malcolm in the Middle, Married with Children, Breaking Bad, or pretty much any TV show ever?

Bad Family is a game where everyone plays a star in an animated sit-com about the dysfunctional Jones family as they have the worst day of their lives.

158162.name: Military Geography
158162.description: Military Geography is a game of strategy similar to the war exercises played out by Admirals and Generals in the defense Department and the United States War College. Player learn about navigations, military strategy, tactical, maneuvering, positioning, networking, and logistics.

158163.name: Invazions
158163.description:
Invazions is an asymmetric card game.

One player embodies what is left of the human race, whereas all of the other players cooperate as zombies hordes. Goals and gameplays are different for each side. Manage your resources and find the cure, or improve your hoard with a new deckbuilding system and free the zombies captured for genetic experiments, the choice is yours!

158164.name: DD Mau
158164.description:
A fast paced, "in your face card game" or slow down and teach the kids strategy, math and decision making skills. Skip and hit any other player on the table, lay down long runs like in rummy. Go out with big points. Get caught with the Deck Master and you're the dealer. If you've ever liked UNO, Then you'll love DD Mau!

The deck consists of 80 playing cards, 52 of which are numbered 1 - 13 in four colors. The remaining 28 cards are “Power Cards”.

Players get rid of their cards by following the color, matching the number of the card on the discard pile or by playing a “POWER CARD”.

The hand is over when any player gets rid of all the cards in his or her hand. That player SUBTRACTS the total points from the card or cards that player went out with from their base score. All other players ADD the total of the card or cards in their hand and add it to their base score. The game is over when any player's score EXCEEDS 505 points. In the event that a player's score is 500, 501, 502, 503, 504 or 505 then that player's score is reduced to 400 and play resumes.

The winner is the player with the lowest score at the end of the game.

158165.name: Space Racing Game
158165.description:
Space Racing Game is a tactical racing game in which players take control of powerful space ships, facing them against each other. Players race simulated space ships with the hope of crossing the finish line first.

Each ship has its own unique maneuvers and powers.

At start of the game the players will buy ships and components.

Space Racing Game is a tactical game of miniatures, cards and dice which takes place in two phases:
1. Planning
2. Moving

Planning phase: at the same time each Player secretly chooses one maneuver and speed using dial.

After Planning phase, each Player move their ships and use its powers.

In sequential order all Players perform their “Moving phase” (Player initiative).

Moving phase: the player has to use a move template and move their space ship, which was secretly chosen.

Players take penalties if they miss their maneuvers, bump into another ship, are blocked by other ships.
The player with the most game points wins the game.

Space Racing Game has 3 different scenarios (racing types) and each of them has its own set of special rules and victory conditions.
However, the fun does not end with a single race! The game rules include the ability to customize your ships and change ships components types to modify your speed, maneuvers, powers and special abilities.
You should plan your strategy, and complete your mission!

158166.name: Onslaught at Arda I
rpghonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
158166.description:
From the publisher's website:
Onslaught at Arda I is an adventure supplement for the Star Wars: Age of Rebellion Roleplaying Game which explores the themes of desperate struggles, tenuous alliances, and an overwhelming enemy. This 96-page adventure is set at Arda I, a secret Rebel Base, and features mass-combat rules that Game Master’s can use to bring large battles to life, along with in-depth gazetteers that cover the Arda I base, and all-new adversary and vehicle profiles!

158167.description:
The Blood Contagion Mission Pack adds the Infected to MERCS: Recon

Infected in Recon are experiments that have gone bad. They are considered to be Employees. If they are killed, civilian penalties apply. However, Infected do not try to leave the building like other Employees. They seek out and attack other OpFor and MERCS.

The Infected have a chance to turn other OpFor into Infected. Infected OpFor are replaced with special Infected OpFor cards and are marked with a token. Infected OpFor have altered priorities and do different things. The mini-campaign in Blood Contagion revolves around the MERCS going deep into a lab, finding the cure, not letting the Infected get out-of-hand, and saving as many Infected as possible.

Additionally, the Infected bring with them a completely new way for the MERCS to lose: if ever there are 15 Infected in the structure the MERCS have been defeated.

This Mission Pack is a Myth Crossover. The Infected can also be used as Minions in Myth.

The Infected Minions are tough to kill. They have 3 Vitality. On a successful attack, the Infected roll a 1FD. If the Infected rolls the Darkness symbol, the Hero cannot produce treasure. Additionally, if that Hero while infected becomes adjacent to other Heroes, then the infected Hero rolls 1FD for each Hero adjacent. If the roll matches the defining attribute, then the adjacent Hero becomes infected and can no longer generate treasure either.
158167.name: MERCS: Recon – Blood Contagion

158168.description:
Play as an All-Star Captain, build your ultimate team, score the most goals and win the cup!

Captain your very own Pro Hockey Team in the NHL Power Play Team-Building Card Game. With your Captain card to guide you, put together the best team you can from names across all 30 NHL teams. Every card features the stars of the NHL in high-resolution action shots. Can you light the lamp enough times to win the game?

Compete for the best attackers, the best defenders, the best skills, and the best maneuver cards. Each card you add to your team will build upon the strategy you have chosen. Soon your team will act like a well-oiled machine and you’ll be ready to take a shot on goal. If you can beat the goalie, you score a point! The player who scores the most points wins. Games typically end with "hockey scores" like 4-3.

When you take a shot on goal, the action is tense. Before you reveal all of the tricks up your sleeve, there is a chance for defenders to interfere with your attack. The more defenders that get in your way, the harder it will be to score. After the defenders (if any) have been revealed, you play out your hand. That’s right! The defenders won’t know who’s crashing the net until after they have coordinated their defense. Now that you know what you’re up against, play your cards and see if your strategy and players were good enough to overcome the defenses and the goalie. If it is, you score!
158168.name: NHL Power Play Team-Building Card Game
boardgameexpansion: NHL Power Play Team-Building Card Game: Henrik Sedin Promo
