158399.name: Victory Decision: Future Combat – Rival Species
158399.description:
Rival Species is the first expansion for Victory Decision: Future Combat and focuses on genetically engineered alien threats.

Some alien races engineer and grow all of their technology organically. This could be due to viewing mechanical technology as blasphemy or the species could be a predatory culture with no higher goals than the propagation of their species and the destruction of any other life that could pose a threat.

A Bio-Engineered force is not governed by a strict military structure in the way other races are. The group intelligence of the Bio-Engineered Aliens allows them to integrate a huge amount of hordes until their armies become immense forces, crushing any resistance that crosses its path.

Rival Species brings you a complete army list, new Special Rules like an additional Overwatch Action, new Psi Powers, new Abilities and Weapon Features.

A copy of the Victory Decision: Future Combat rulebook is necessary to fully use the content of this book.

158400.description:
Doraemon Bingo POP is a different kind of bingo game. This game can be played in two versions: The easy version: Doraemon Bingo, or the strategic version: Doraemon Bingo POP.

The Differences are the following:

In Doraemon Bingo, each player takes his/her own board. In Doraemon Bingo POP put all game boards together and all players share the board.

In Doraemon Bingo, only yellow cards are used and each player takes 2 cards in his hands during the game. In Doraemon Bingo POP, all the cards are used and each player takes 3 cards in his hands during the game.

In Doraemon Bingo, all players place a ring on their own board when a player plays a card. In Doraemon Bingo POP only the player who played the card places the ring.
158400.name: Doraemon Bingo Pop

158401.description: Things just got real. This new deck is filled with cards that are played during and throughout the turns of the game, introducing unexpected events that force you to think on your feet and be ready for anything. Events make the game unpredictable and volatile. You’ll need all your wits about you to stay ahead when everything around you is shifting.
158401.name: The Agents: Events

158402.description:
Screw the rules! Spice up your gameplay with rule-breaking cards that set up new game conditions from the start of the game that make every game different and much more dangerous. This mega-expansion includes 3 different expansions; a new Break-The-Rules deck, Commanders deck and Sites deck.

The Commander Agents are cards that are given to players before the game begins. Each Commander bestows a special benefit to the player who owns it, and each benefit lasts throughout the game.
158402.name: The Agents: Break the Rules

158403.description:
Boom Bomb Game is a classic "Crazy Eights" game. Players play cards that fit either the color or the number of the previous card on the dicard pile. Whoever gets rid of their cards first wins.

But once a bomb is drawn, the explosive nature of the game is revealed. These bombs bring a new flavor to a classic game. When a player draws a bomb card all players have to draw a card from the card pile. If the color matches that of the bomb, the bomb explodes and this player has to draw 4 cards.
158403.name: Boom Bomb Game

158404.description: Get your rivals to do your dirty work. By putting a bounty on an Agent’s head, you can manipulate your opponents to do your bidding. This expansions forces you to enlist the help of other players to get the job done. But WHO is the job? This expansion also contains brand new, much requested, point TOKENS!
158404.name: The Agents: Bounties

158405.description:
In The Smurfs: Snakes & Ladders, players roll and move their pawns in a race to the finish line, using ladders to their advantage and falling down slides when they can't avoid it.

But not only players are taking part in the race: Gargamel is chasing the Smurfs from behind, threatening to catch them. This added dynamic element serves to add freshness and excitement to an old formula and makes the game deeply immersive for young players.
158405.name: The Smurfs: Snakes & Ladders

158406.name: Mesa Grown-ups Playing Cards
158406.description:
The Mesa Grown-ups card deck is a special version of the Mesa Playing Cards that uses caricatures of real people for the card faces. The deck consists of 48 cards, 42 Character cards and 6 Object cards. Each card has a set of attributes: Value, Power and Clan. The attributes are different than the attributes in the regular Mesa deck.

The Mesa Grown-ups deck can be played independently or with the regular Mesa deck.

There are 9 games that have been created for the Mesa card: "Playground Wars", "Heroic Dreams", "Revolution", "Power of Love", "Save the Baby", "Mesa Puzzled", "Tower Building Babel" and "Mesa Patterned."

"Revolution" game uses both the regular deck and the Mesa Grown-ups deck of cards.

158407.name: Bats!
158407.description:
from the designer

It has been said that it is impossible to make a game about superheroes, because everyone wants to be Batman. Well, I suppose when everyone isn’t trying to be Wolverine. Anyway, for the first time, everyone can now be Batman!

In this case, everyone gets to be a slightly different version of Batman…from gravelly throated Dark Knights to campy public service message 60’s Batmen to Scarlet Pimpernell-inspired fisticuff pulpy Detectives-In-The-Night. Sure, the comics may have proven that Batman could possibly beat Superman in a fight…but who wins in a fight when Batman meets Batman?

Don’t try to figure out how your universe has multiple Batmen and Bruce Waynes…it just is. Make the most of it. And don’t worry too much that in the comics, most likely Batman would only get “the good dice” during his scene; remember the other Batmen around the table already have a contingency plan for whoever has spotlight.

158408.description:
In Coup, you want to be the last player with influence in the game, with influence being represented by face-down character cards in your playing area.

Each player starts the game with two coins and two influence – i.e., two face-down character cards; the fifteen card deck consists of three copies of five different characters, each with a unique set of powers. Players take turns taking various actions with the goal to reduce all of his or her opponents to 0 influence. The last player to still have influence – that is, a face-down character – wins the game!

Its expansion, Coup: Reformation, adds new cards to the game and rules for factions and team play that increases tension.

Each player must declare himself either a Loyalist or a Resistant and can target only members of the other faction. Conversion is possible for yourself or for another player by paying a charitable donation to the Treasury. Like all factions, once you have eliminated or converted the other group, you just descend into in-fighting, so there's still only one winner and no second place.
158408.name: Coup: Deluxe Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 019 – I, Geek Interviews Rikki Tahta

158409.description:
A dark game of curses and lynching...

The Salem Curse is a hidden roles type game in which the players take on the roles of innocent villagers, law enforcement, and yes, even a witch. The Salem Curse offers a new spin on the classic "werewolf" style game with a unique mechanic that actually has the witch curse the other townsfolk right out in the open...while staying completely hidden in the crowd.
158409.name: The Salem Curse

158411.name: Choose Your Crew: Rockband
158411.description:
Battle it out with a rival to become the greatest Rock Band in the world!

Choose Your Crew: Rockband is a 2 player card game designed to Rock! Gather your crew of roadies and techies for support before battling it out with screaming guitars and pounding drums on stage. Each band member must prove his worth with Skill and Popularity to avoid the dreaded Magazine Headlines. Hair spray catches fire, feedback deafens the crowd, stage props fall and equipment gets stolen but gather the right support crew and you will thrash and mosh your way to the top!

Along the way earn Gold Albums and steal support crew from a rival. Then use those dedicated crew members and outstanding stage performances to boost your band members' attributes before challenging a rival to a Battle of the Bands! It's a card game. Play it loud!

158412.name: Styx: Master of Shadows
158412.description:
The story takes place long before the events shown in Of Orcs and Men. Styx, the first Goblin, wants to steal the heart of a World-Tree enclosed inside the huge and terrifying Tower of Akenash. It is a kind of Bildungsroman that leads Styx to a better understanding of his own origins.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Styx:_Master_of_Shadows," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

158413.name: Mind Zero
158413.description:
The game will take place in two different "worlds"; the real world, and a "crazy spiritual world". The real world aspect of the game is set in Japan, in the regions Akihabara, Yokohama, Amamiya and Nippori. Specifically, the game takes place in the Saitama Prefecture.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mind_Zero,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

158414.name: XBlaze Code: Embryo
158414.description:
User Summary

XBlaze Code: Embryo is a prequel to the game series BlazBlue. Set 50 years before the Dark War and 150 years before the events of Calamity Trigger, XBlaze Code: Embryo introduces Toya Kagari, a normal high school student who is introduced to the mysterious "Power of the Azure."

158415.name: Tales of Hearts R
158415.description:
User Summary

Tales of Hearts R is a full remake of the original for the PlayStation Vita. It features fully voiced dialogue, new events, two new playable party members (Calcedony Arkham and Galad Grinus), and 3D graphics. The battles now have a focus on jumping up and taking the fight to the air.

The limited edition, known as Tales of Hearts R: Link Edition, contains several Vita accessories such as decals, cleaning cloth, and a pouch.

158416.description:
Kircholm 1605 is a follow-up scenario of Nieuport 1600 (Vae Victis 105). The rules are derived from Musket & Pike (GMT Games). It includes a rules booklet of 6 pages, 108 counters, one A3 map.

The Battle of Kircholm is an episode of the the Polish-Swedish War of 1600-1611, which took place 27 September 1605 near the town of Kircholm (now Salaspils in Latvia, near Riga), between the Swedish army commanded by Karl IX and the Polish-Lithuanian army commanded by Jan Karol Chodkiewicz, Field Hetman of Lithuania. Although outnumbered, The battle was decided in 20 minutes by the devastating charge of Polish-Lithuanian cavalry, the Winged Hussars. The battle ended in the decisive victory of Polish-Lithuanian forces, and is remembered as one of the greatest triumphs of Commonwealth cavalry.
158416.name: Kircholm 1605

158417.name: Skull Cave
158417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Centuries ago nomads found a cave and felt drawn to perform their death rites to dark gods within its confines. Years of ritualistic offerings to malevolent forces has fed demons deep below the cave. The nomads have long since disappeared, but a recent earth tremor has freed the demon spawn from their prison deep below the surface. Seeking blood of victims to fuel their infernal fires they have moved closer to the surface and begun their hunt.

A Pocket-Sized Encounter compatible with the Swords & Wizardry rules system for 4th to 6th level character.

Pocket-Sized Encounters from Iron Tavern Press are shorter scenarios designed to be dropped into an existing campaign with minimal preparation. Use them for shorter sessions, provide your players with choices that won’t derail your campaign or even as a launching point for a new campaign path.

Included in this product are:

New Bloodfire Demon Monster
Multiple adventure hooks
Location based encounter area maps (GM, Player versions in grid and gridless format)
Seeds for expanding the adventure
Random Treasure Hoard table

158418.name: Jackrabbit
158418.description:
From publisher blurb:

JACKRABBIT!

Jumping on to the scene is Jackrabbit, martial artist and criminal extraordinaire! Armed with deadly chi powers and a one-two kick that could knock a hero through a wall, he's ready to take on any heroes that cross his path!

158419.name: Paladins of Porphyra
158419.description:
From publisher blurb:

"By the Right of Law and Good and this blessed sword!"

In a world sharply divided by religious and elemental belief, where the origin of entire nations can be another world, who can be counted on, every time, to do what is right? Paladins. Shining examples of goodness and law, they can be depended upon to stand fast in the face of darkness and evil. And on the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, they are needed more than anywhere. But are they all created equal, armored hulks with longswords and naive dispositions? Not by a long shot... and what of those who oppose Law and Goodness, favorites of the Chaotic Evil Elemental Lords... the antipaladins!

Paladins of Porphyra is packed with playable power with the following-

5 paladin archetypes, for lawful neutral and neutral good, as well as lawful good Gods of Porphyra, including Codionic Knights, Gyrfalcons, and Darksiege paladins
3 Oaths for oathbound paladins, such as oaths against anarchy, deforestation, and darkness
5 antipaladin oaths, pertaining to the New Gods and the foul Elemental Lords, including oaths of submersion and subterfuge, and the malborn and deathdancer antipaladin, 2 brand-new archetypes!




Challenge the heights of righteousness or plumb the depths of depravity with Paladins of Porphyra, available from Purple Duck Games today!

158420.name: Ragnarok Odyssey ACE
158420.description:
User Summary

Ragnarok Odyssey Ace is an updated version of Ragnarok Odyssey developed for the PlayStation Vita and PlayStation 3.

This new version of the game contains new enemies, new skills, new dungeons (like Yggdrasil Tower), new HUD, new gameplay balance adjustment, an extra episode after the ending, and all the DLC from the original game.

First print copies of the game also included an in-game bonus. It's possible to import save data from the original game to use them in Ragnarok Odyssey Ace.

158421.name: Brawl in a Box #1
158421.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hey – aren’t these the same as your Untold Encounters?
Yes and no. While they are very similar to our line of Untold Encounters, A "Brawl in a Box" is merely one ongoing title in our long line of Untold Campaign Conversion Products. Because Untold is so flexible, we can easily adapt one product into another; our line of "Brawl in a Box" products are yet another way we are able to show that!

So what are they?
Basically, a "Brawl in a Box" is an M&M3E product that utilizes concepts, characters, and setting information from the "default" Untold Campaign Setting: Splintered Serenity ™. We take our races, creatures and monsters, convert them to the M&M3E Open Rule-set and you’ve got a complete "mini-adventure" that’s self-contained and ready to go! Each "Brawl in a Box" contains everything you need to run the adventure – the map, (or at least a sample map and a link to the excellent SkeletonKey Games map product), how to construct the battlefield, the setup, and all of the creatures (fully stated into M&M3e format) that you’ll need, plus counters! Use it as a random encounter, use it as an adventure hook, or even as a climatic final fight – it’s up to you!

Brawl in a Box #1
NAU High-bred, led by a heroic NAU HERo Sergeant must pit their equipment, intellect and abilities against a slavering horde of tentacled, diabolical, mind-devouring beasts from Beyond as they invade a Flux Horror Hive! Which side will you be on? Who will survive and be claimed the victor of Brawl in a Box #1! Contains:

Seven (7) new NAU/Military-style M&M3e Minions, fully stated and ready to play: Grunt, Grenaider, Firebug, Sniper, HERo Sergeant, War Dog, Cavalry
Six (6) new, never-before-seen "Cthulhuesque" Flux Horror M&M3e Minions, fully stated and ready to play: Corrupter, Flux Warper, Hydra Strand, Rift Ripper, Shardthrower, Wrecker
Full color tiles/tokens for each new Minion
Complete Background, Setup, Movement and Hazards rules needed to run the encounter
Complete instructions for building the SkeletonKey Games map contained in Skeleton Key Games Tiles: e-Adventure Tiles: Cave Passages

158422.name: Minions of Splintered Serenity: Flux Horrors
158422.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new era for Mutants and Masterminds (3e) and Untold continues with Flux Horrors!

Ignitus Innovation, Inc. continues its line of setting conversion products with their latest release, Minions of Splintered Serenity™: Flux Horrors, a "mini monster manual" for M&M3e; find the information on this product below:

All that is terrible, all that is unknown, all that is perversion and all that is penultimate chaos - these things make up what the Flux Horrors are! Ancient and evil, mind-warping and soul-stealing entities from bizarre dimensions far beyond our own: the Flux Horrors (also known as Externals) have entered into Untold's triune world of Splintered Serenity and now they can enter your M&M3e world too!

If you need to add an element of "eldritch horror" into your game, Flux Horrors is the way to go! Vile, dripping, tentacle-laden nastiness awaits within these pages... Creatures slavering and diabolically plotting to twist and pervert hapless characters into their willing thralls - all for their own incomprehensible plans which could well lead to complete cosmic domination, or destruction!

Minions of Splintered Serenity™: Flux Horrors contains:

Eight (8) new "Cthluhu-esque" M&M3e Minions, fully stated and ready to play: Corrupter, Disciple of Pain, Flux Warper, Hydra Strand, Infested Churl, Rift Ripper, Shardthrower
Complete Setting, Background, and Tactics sections for all new Flux Horror Minions
Setting and Background information on the Splintered Serenity™ Untold setting, as well as rules and tips on conversion to M&M3e

158423.name: Minions of Splintered Serenity: NAU
158423.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new era for Mutants and Masterminds (3e) and Untold continues!

Ignitus Innovation, Inc. continues its line of setting conversion products with their latest release, Minions of Splintered Serenity™: NAU, a "mini monster manual" for M&M3e; find the information on this product below:

The North American Union, or NAU is all that is left of the mighty military forces of what was once the proud country of America. Since the world-shattering Event, however, little remains of that once powerful nation - little that is good, that is. The NAU is one of those few bright stars in the dark sea of destruction and chaos that now ravages the North American continent.

The NAU are a group of stalwart Apoc High-bred, genetic super-soldiers who survived the Event and now battle to keep the idea of freedom and America alive. Arrayed against them are horrific forces: loathsome Undead of all forms who comprise the dreaded Undead Infection as well as the reality-warping and soul-snatching Flux Horrors. Struggling to survive in the blasted landscape of Splintered Serenity™, the NAU are humanity's last line of defense...

Minions of Splintered Serenity™: NAU contains:

Eight (8) new NAU/Military-style M&M3e Minions, fully stated and ready to play: Grunt, Grenaider, Firebug, Glue Gunner, Sniper, HERo Sergeants, War Dog, Cavalry
Two (2) Optional Templates, fully stated and ready to play: NAU Assault Rifleman & NAU Calvary Rider
Complete Setting, Background, and Tactics sections for all new Minions
Setting and Background information on the Splintered Serenity™ Untold setting, as well as rules and tips on conversion to M&M3e

158424.name: Races of Splintered Serenity: High-bred
158424.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new era for Mutants and Masterminds (3e) and Untold continues!

Ignitus Innovation, Inc. has released Races of Splintered Serenity™: High-bred, the first in their line of setting conversion products that bring the world of Splintered Serenity to the Mutants and Masterminds rules. Find the information on this product below:

In the shattered reality that is Splintered Serenity™, the Apoc High-bred are the last bastions of human society. Genetically engineered humans, their ancestors were long ago blessed with traits and powers that made them much more than human. When the world-shattering Event occurred, this blessing became the only thing that kept them alive. Now, only the Apoc - of all humankind - survive in the blasted, post-apocalyptic world of Post-Event Earth. The High-bred are the only ones who even try and maintain a measure of order and civilization. Only through their dogged determination, their uniquely crafted gear and their genetic superpowers are they able to make a stand against the ravages of a world gone to hell.

What you'll find in this PDF:

Apoc High-bred M&M3e template
Setting and Background information on High-bred Society, Relations, Adventurers, Nations, and Applicable Skills
Ten (10) new High-bred M&M3e Powers
Six (6) new High-bred M&M3e Martial Arts Powers
Nine (9) new High-bred M&M3e Weapons and Equipment statistics and rules (includes Melee, Ranged, Explosive Weapons and Armor)
Setting and Background information on the Splintered Serenity™ Untold setting, as well as rules and tips on conversion to M&M3e
Four (4) Exclusive and new Untold Transverse Power Cards – never before seen anywhere!

158425.name: TPS Report # A12.6 - Subject: Sarge
158425.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the unusual extra-dimensional organization known as iniTech comes a new TPS (Temporal Personnel Surveillance) Report on Sarge, one of the hard-hitting, militaristic Apoc High-bred. iniTech does its job admirably and makes certain that its clients have ALL the necessary information needed when assessing new potential threats or allies, regardless of the universe they inhabit.

TPS Reports bring the core Untold setting: Splintered Serenity to the M&M Third Edition Ruleset. Part Post-Apocalyptic, Steampunk, and High Fantasy, Splintered Serenity will let you play a whole new game with the rules you already know.

This, like all TPS Reports, comes with the standard required Cover Sheet (and yes, we read the memo about the new ones), an introduction by an iniTech Agent, and a detailed field report on the intended Subject. Further, you will find not one, but TWO character sheets with M&M Third Edition Game information for both the Heroic (PL 4) and Veteran Hero (PL 9) stages of the character's development! Use this TPS Report to easily introduce an advanced, militaristic, genetically-engineered edge into your M&M games!

Expanded sections on the Evolution of the character, six Hooks to aid you in incorporating the character into your game, and TWO distinct Untold Character Builds (complete with QRC) that mimic the M&M Third Edition builds, so you're ready for play in either M&M or Untold!

TPS Report, Subject: Sarge

No-nonsense and 99% business, Sarge is the epitome of the the Apoc High-bred, but she has a secret that could spell her doom -- and the doom of any around her. Haunted by visions of a nightmarish place that can only be termed "Beyond" an visited by a....something....that refers to itself as the Longfaced Man, Sarge has her work cut out for her. Sarge is not one to give up, however, with her trusty M1201 Assault Rifle and Silver Saber by her side, she just might come out on top!

158426.name: Heróis & Histórias
158426.description:
From Introduction:

O Que é Heróis & Histórias?

Este jogo pretende ser mais um dos vários jogos de RPG existentes. Mas, por que outro? O que ele oferece que outros não possuem? Talvez nada, talvez muita coisa. Isso dependerá do que os jogadores desejam. Heróis & Histórias (ou H&H, para manter o padrão de letras iguais nas siglas de jogos de fantasia) pretende ser um sistema OldSchool, ou de Velha Guarda, ou Escolavéia (by Nitro).



Translation courtesy of Google:What it is Heroes & Stories?

This game aims to be one of the several existing RPG games. But why else? What does it offer that others do not have? Maybe nothing, maybe a lot. This will depend on what the players want. Heroes & Stories (or H & M, to maintain the standard of equal letters in the acronyms of fantasy games) OldSchool intended as a system, or Old Guard, or Escolavéia (by Nitro).

158427.name: Pacific Rim Role-Playing Game
158427.description:
From Introduction:

Para defender a humanidade dos Kaiju (“monstro” em japonês), alienígenas colossais que chegam à Terra por meio de uma fenda nas profundezas do oceano Pacífico, as nações da Terra criaram os Jaegers (“caçador” em alemão). Eles são divididos em 5 Categorias (“Mark”).



Translation courtesy of Google:To defend humanity from the colossal Kaiju ("monster" in Japanese), aliens who come to Earth through a rift in the depths of the Pacific Ocean, the nations of the earth created the Jaegers ("hunter" in German). They are divided into 5 categories ("Mark").

158428.name: A Cidade de Nokton
158428.description:
From Introduction:

Arton-sul. Mais conhecido como Lamnor. Ao leste, a região litorânea mostra-se de uma geografia irregular, apresentando reentrâncias, penínsulas, baías, golfos e o mar intrometido. Toda a terra demolida e atirada para formar montanhas e morros. O mar abraça e comprime extensas áreas.



Translation courtesy of Google:Arton-south. Better known as Lamnor. To the east, the coastal region is shown an uneven geography, with recesses, peninsulas, bays, gulfs and nosy sea. All land demolished and thrown to form mountains and hills. The sea embraces and compresses large areas.

158429.name: A Corrente de Derketa
158429.description:
From Introduction:

Há muito tempo, cantam bardos pelo mundo inteiro sobre as façanhas de um homem que tornou-se um mito. Seu nome era Khailia, o príncipe dos Ladrões. Uma de suas histórias mais famosas é sobre sua derradeira façanha, em que desafiou a própria morte ao roubar a Corrente de Derketa.



Translation courtesy of Google:Long ago, the world bards singing about the exploits of a man who became a myth. His name was Khailia, Prince of Thieves. One of his most famous stories is about his ultimate feat that defied death itself to steal the current Derketa.

158430.name: A Flor de Lótus: Uma ofídica casa de chá
158430.description:
From Introduction:

A Flor de Lótus é provavelmente a mais antiga e maior casa de chá de toda Arton, desde que a Tormenta aniquilou a grande ilha chamada Tamura. Foi fundada na pequena comunidade Tamura-niana que começava a se formar em Valkaria, pelo jovem e rico comerciante Norimoto Shigeru há mais ou menos trinta e seis anos.



Translation courtesy of Google:The Lotus Flower is probably the oldest and largest house of all Arton tea, since Storm destroyed the big island called Tamura. It was founded in the small community Tamura-Niana that began to form in Valkaria, the young and wealthy merchant Norimoto Shigeru There are about thirty-six.

158431.name: Pivit
158431.description:
From the publisher:

Race your opponents as you arrange your 24 tiles crossword-style by matching color and design. Every tile must connect, and a row of two just won’t do. Use a trade token to swap a tricky tile and hope for a Wild tile in return. You will need to switch, shuffle and "pivit" your tiles to place them all and claim the highest scoring stick.


Each tile features one of six different colors and one of six different designs. Every player draws 24 tiles, and then races the other players to complete an interlocking grid with those tiles. A row or column in the grid must contain at least three tiles, and the tiles must feature either all the same design or all the same color. If the designs in a row or column are the same, then all the colors must be different, and vice versa. Players may discard tiles and draw replacements if they have trouble completing their grids. Players score according to the order in which they completed their grids. The first player to 24 points wins.

158433.name: Day One: Garry's Incident
158433.description:
Day One: Garry's Incident follows Garry Friedman, a pilot who recently lost his wife and daughter, as he is transported to the Amazon Rainforest following the explosion of the Yellowstone Caldera by magical ancient artifacts. he encounters rabid wildlife that is later found to be linked to a ritual by the natives.

Source: Wikipedia, "Day One: Garry's Incident", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

158434.name: Robinson Crusoe Game
158434.description:
A vintage game (1961 or 1962) for up to four players who move a little boat around a series of Islands in search of Robinson Crusoe and Friday.

On a player's turn he or she spins the arrow and will move either the ship or his pawn that many spaces. The ship moves in a circle around a series of islands stopping at a pier on each island where a player can leave the ship and then move point to point across the island to a location where a counter is placed.

Most counters are blank on the reverse side. There are however two counters (one for Robinson Crusoe, and another for his man Friday). When the player finds both locations, which he keeps secret from his opponents, he must then take the ship back to the starting island and declare where he believes the Crusoe and Friday counters are located.

There are a total of 10 counters placed face down on ten different locations (one on each of 10 islands). The spinner also has two spaces which indicate the player should draw a card instead of move a certain number of spaces. The cards either direct the player to "move the ship to any island", or move the Pawn directly to any island without having to use the ship to carry his pawn.

158435.description:
Dogs of War is an elegant game set in a steampunk-influenced renaissance universe. Noble houses engage each other in a series of fierce battles, and it's up to the players and the Dogs of War they control to deploy their private armies in support of whatever house they wish to favor. Clockwork knights and imposing war machines shift the tides of war as they enter the battlefields, but the interest of their Dog of War captains actually lie in the rewards offered by each noble house to its supporters. Each Dog of War has a special ability that helps them claim influence, win battles, or betray the house to which they've sworn allegiance!

Dogs of War is not a game of pure military power, but rather a game in which deception and betrayal often lead the way to a decisive victory. The goal for the Dogs of War is to earn the most power by the end of the game. Thanks to thoughtful game design and development, there are many ways to achieve this, like defeating other captains in battle, getting rewards from the Houses you help, amassing gold and troops, and most importantly, gaining influence with the most successful Houses.
158435.name: Dogs of War
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cool Mini or Not Board Games Review Special
Ep. 9 Isaac Vega
Episode 48 - City of Iron 2nd Ed.
GenCon 2014 - Cool Mini or Not
Pap under juletræet
Perfect Information Episode 17 - Social Engineering
Top 10 Favorite Board Games of All Time

158436.name: A Taverna de Ryaner
158436.description:
From Introduction:

Petrynia é o palco de muitas lendas e histórias (pelo menos seus habitantes garantem que sim), e há uma que diz haver, na cidade de Trandia, uma taverna onde o proprietário vende bebidas capazes de derrubar um ogro. A maioria acha que é apenas mais uma das histórias fantásticas de Petrynia, mas os que vão conferir acabam se deparando com a taverna de Ryaner.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Petrynia is the scene of many legends and stories (at least its inhabitants guarantee so), and there is a saying there, in the city of Trandia, a tavern where the owner sells drinks capable of shooting down an ogre. Most think it's just one of the fantastic stories Petrynia, but that will give end up running into the tavern Ryaner.

158438.name: A Torre dos Três Magos
158438.description:
From Introduction:

A Torre dos Três Magos é uma estrutura bela, que pode ser vista de qualquer parte da cidade. Com mais de 50 metros de altura, suas rochas escuras são ornamentadas por gárgulas esculpidas (dizem) por Zentura, a medusa de Vectora. Hoje ela também é tomada pela hera, o que lhe dá um aspecto sombrio e antigo, apesar de ter sido construída há pouco tempo. Muitas janelas pequenas rodeiam a torre e no alto há um terraço. Poucas pessoas sabem ao certo como ela é por dentro, nem mesmo os serviçais que trabalham lá, pois os magos não os autorizam a entrar em todos aposentos. Os boatos que circulam falam sobre bibliotecas imensas com livros do tipos mais variados, desde os que se movem aos que são pequenos demais para serem lidos a olho nu; salas repletas de garrafas e líquidos brilhantes de cores vivas; tapeçarias riquíssimas e objetos ornamentais de todos os lugares do Reinado; portas que estão sempre trancadas; passagens secretas e possíveis corredores subterrâneos que se estendem mais longe do que se pensa. A única coisa que se sabe ao certo é que por dentro a torre parece muito maior do que por fora...


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Tower of the Three Magi is a beautiful structure , which can be seen from any part of town . With over 50 feet tall , his dark rocks are embellished with carved gargoyles ( say ) by zentura , the jellyfish Vectora . Today it is also taken by ivy , which gives it a dark, old , despite having been built recently aspect . Many small windows surround the tower and at the top there is a terrace . Few people know exactly how it is inside, even the servants who work there , as the magi did not authorize them to go into all quarters. The rumors circulating talk about huge libraries with books of all kinds , from moving to that are too small to be read with the naked eye ; rooms full of bottles of liquid and bright vivid ; very rich tapestries and ornamental objects everywhere in the Kingdom ; doors are always locked ; secret passages and possible underground corridors that extend farther than you think . The only thing known for sure is that inside the tower looks much bigger than out ...

158439.name: Agência de Talentos: “O Canto do Bardo”
158439.description:
From Introduction:

O Canto do Bardo foi fundado por um antigo comerciante. Seu nome era Difan Loredonis, ou simplesmente Lore. Lore andava de cidade em cidade com sua caravana, comprando e vendendo mercadorias, enfim, um comerciante normal.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Bard's Corner was founded by a former trader. His name was Difan Loredonis, or simply Lore. Lore walked from town to town with his caravan, buying and selling goods, in short, a normal trader.

158440.name: Alaris
158440.description:
From Introduction:

O Povo Borboleta
Esta antiqüíssima raça teria sido criação da deusa Allihanna e habitava as profundezas das Florestas de Naria. Havia apenas uma cidade de alaris, na verdade uma metrópole, conhecida como Börbelethia. Era uma cidade imensa, construída na copa das mais altas árvores, sendo quase impossível de ser detectada por meios mundanos. Este povo vivia com esplendor, mas no auge de sua glória foi bruscamente extinto.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Butterfly People
That very ancient race would have been creation of the Goddess Allihanna and inhabited the depths of the forests Naria. There was only one city alaris actually a metropolis, known as Börbelethia. It was a huge city, built on the tops of the tallest trees, being almost impossible to be detected by worldly means. These people lived in splendor, but at the height of his glory was suddenly extinguished.

158441.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 274 - Jun 1998)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
158441.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #274
June 1998

Cover art by David Okamura.

158442.name: Tacky, Tawdry and Tasteless
158442.description:
subtitle
the Reality Show RPG

from the introduction
Tacky. Tawdry. Tasteless. All of these words accurately sum up the “reality show” genre. Yet people continue to flock to their televisions in droves to tune in on the exploits of their favorite dysfunctional celebrities, outlandish “Guidos”, child pageant debutantes, or whatever other personalities are being shoved down our collective throats by the networks on any given day. Love it or hate it, this brand of trash TV has captured the imaginations of millions and continues to thrive despite all the negativity of the critics and late- night TV show hosts during their monologues.

This roleplaying game allows us to celebrate these train wrecks that have seemingly entranced the world with their flamboyance, sleaziness and willingness to blatantly wallow in their own debauchery. You and your friends will create your own “show” and play it out, trying desperately to get ratings! Will your show find its way to the top of the dung heap or will it get lost in the muck with the rest of the drivel? Only time will tell.

158443.name: Twenty One
158443.description:
A Scrabble-like game and board that uses number counters instead of letter tiles. The object of the game is to score as many rows of figures that add up to 21. Players take turns placing counters from their personal sets, of which they have three in hand.

Scoring does not begin until the fourth round, to allow numbers to build up on the board. During the initial three rounds players may not place a counter if the total in a straight line in any direction would exceed 21.

From the fourth round on, players aim to place counters so that they complete lines adding up to 21. The basic score for a line adding up to 21 is 5 points, but 10 points can be scored by placing the counter on a square that matches the colour of your own pieces, or more by placing the counter on squares marked 15, 20 or 30, scoring that many points respectively.

When a line adding up to 21 is scored, the counter that was last placed is turned face down. No counters may be placed adjacent to such a counter, except for the counter with a star, which counts as 21 in its own right.

The game ends when one player has used all his counters on no player is able to play.

The player with the highest score is the winner.

158444.name: Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: My Life as a Darklord
158444.description:
From the user guide:

FINAL FANTASY CRYSTAL CHRONICLES: My Life as a Darklord is a world-conquest RPG that puts you in the role of the Darklord Mira. Using artifacts (traps) and monsters, you must strategically control your armies to dispatch the adventurers who attempt to invade the tower that is your home.

158445.description:
Take the wheel of the greatest adventure ever: the Portuguese Discoveries.

Climb aboard Caravelas II, the game that takes you through seas that were never sailed before to reproduce the beginning of the Portuguese empire.

Decide your own strategy and sail across the world seaking the destinations that made the commercial success of Portugal in those times. Fill up your Caravelas with spices and precious metals and return to Lisbon to claim glory and all the points you earned in your journey. But you must be careful when passing the Cape of Good Hope, "Adamastor" may sink your boats.

This simplified version comes from the success of "Caravelas", and maintains the goal and amazing graphics of the previous game, as well as its didactic interest, but in which rules and play duration are reduced in order to make it more accessible to young players.

How is it played?

Each player in turn spends up to 4 of his motion cards to move his caravels (by moving the corresponding number of squares on the predetermined sea routes). Then he can discover locations, load resources, and deliver them in Lisbon to gain victory points. At the end of his move, he can return the motion cards that he did not spend or save them for the next play. Finally, he picks new cards until he has 4 motion cards in his hand and the turn passes to the next player.

The game is much simpler than "Caravelas" (1st version) in several aspects. There are less components. Only 4 pages of rules (instead of 16). Caravels move only on predetermined routes. Number of moves is determined by the motion cards (instead of depending on the route followed by the ship). There are no event cards. Management of the ships is simplified. Etc.

This new version of the game has been developed for a broader (and/or younger) public.
158445.name: Caravelas II

158446.description:
A children's game where you will compete in a show jumping.

At first you have to find four different equipment-tiles placed face down. After that you roll a die and move your plastic horse around the course with obstacles. According to what you roll different things will happen: After a roll of 1 you must move your horse one step back and take a marker (after three markers you're out of the game). If you would jump over a obstacle after you have rolled a 2, 3 or 4 you have to take the top card from the deck and according to the card's colour different things will happen: If it's green you have passed the jump, if it's yellow you have knocked down the obstacle and get a yellow fault-marker and if it's red your horse has refused to jump and you have to stop and take a red fault-marker. A roll of 5 or 6 makes you just jump over the obstacle without taking a card. The fastest horse with least faults is the winner.

The game is played in the box.
158446.name: Min drömhäst

158447.name: Ranger: Actions at the Objective Expansion Kit
158447.description:
This expansion is a CD with separate pdf files for each mission for the base game and Sierra & Victor expansions. Each file is a full page with the mission's objective, an enlarged map of the objective, and symbol references specific to the mission. Also included is a mission sequence diagram for the extended patrols.

Examples:

Mission 3
Mission 12




This is a digital collection of existing materials with improved formatting, collated onto individual pages for ease of use.

158448.description:
Exciting card game set in high point of Nephite civilization.

Reign of the judges is a card game where you join one of three teams that is fighting to control the judgment seat. One player is the Chief Judge, and everyone else secretly becomes a Nephite, Lamanite, or Gadianton Robber. Nephites are basically the good guys defending their homes; Lamanites are the invading horde intent on complete domination; and Gadianton Robbers want to take over the government secretly from within.

On your turn, you attack players that you believe are on the other teams. When you defeat another player you take one of their votes; your clout in society grows as the defeated player's influence wanes. You win if your team wins the most votes by the end of the game to control the government and become the next Chief Judge.
158448.name: Reign of the Judges

158449.name: James Bond
158449.description:
James Bond is a game of speed and frantic simultaneous action that takes under five minutes to play. It is played with a standard poker deck with Jokers removed. Each player tries to be the first to transform the piles of cards they have been dealt into sets of four-of-a-kind. They do this by exchanging cards from their piles with the four face-up cards in the center of the table. A player may only hold and look at one of his piles at a time, and may only exchange one card at a time with the one of the cards on the table. There are no turns; everyone works at once. The four face-up cards on the table are thus constantly changing along with the makeup of the players' piles. The first player to have converted all his piles to four-of-a-kind is the winner.

James Bond is also known as Atlantis or Chanhassen. Players must say the game's name when they've finished in order to win.

Note: The date and origins of the game are unknown, although it seems to be recent, perhaps as recent as 2009.

158450.description:
Wargame of the Greek Civil War, 1947-49. One of the few times a Communist-inspired insurgency was beaten by a Western government. Uses a development of game system used in several other insurgency situations (Algeria, Tupamaro and Shining Path).

Features include government political interference in how the Army is deployed and supplied, refugees, Balkan sanctuaries, and American support, and the Rebel player has the option of switching his forces to conventional warfare mode if he is confident (or desperate) enough to engage the Army in set-piece battles.
158450.name: Andartes

158451.name: Project Copernicus
158451.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

In Reckoning, the player begins the game by being killed and subsequently resurrected via the Well of Souls, a magical phenomenon capable of bringing the dead back to life. The player's rebirth was a fluke — a one-time success in a long string of failures to conquer death. Several thousand years the magic is perfected, and a Gnomish engineer activates the Well of Souls for everyone on the planet. Suddenly death is no longer a thing.

The game would have explored various issues such as "What does it mean to the societal structures of the world when all of the sudden you've got immortality?" Population, for one thing, doesn't stop growing. The world becomes more and more crowded. "What does it do to the leader of a church whose entire power base is predicated on promising you an afterlife?" Suddenly the churches are no longer needed. How does that effect the moral structure of a society?

158452.description:
'Regno d'Italia' 19th century style Fake Money.
Assorted format.
15.000 lire in total

Expressly made for 1865 Sardinia.
boardgameaccessory: 1865: Sardinia
158452.name: 1865: Sardinia – Italian Style Money

158453.name: Against the Cult of the Bat God
rpgissuearticle: Against the Cult of the Bat God
158453.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for four 5th-level PCs by John Bennett

The Lonely Coast’s most remote village, Oakhurst broods under the dark boughs of the Tangled Woods. Rumours of incest, murder and vile rites during the black of night surround its insular citizens. It is a place most wise people avoid as the very air seems inhospitable to strangers. Yet in the rumours is a grain of truth, for something dark does indeed stir in the shadow haunted trees and hunched homes of Oakhurst. An ancient evil, hungry with the thirst for blood, awakens from its eons long sleep. As disappearances mount and the Lonely Coast can no longer turn a blind eye to the blight that is Oakhurst, heroes are called upon to investigate the foul rumours and mysteries that plague the village. As the search for the truth intensifies, they may find themselves the next victims of a rising, bloodthirsty evil. Can they survive Against the Cult of the Bat God?

Although designed for The Lonely Coast, a free mini-campaign setting available from Raging Swan Press, Against the Cult of the Bat God is simple to insert into almost any GM's home campaign.

158454.name: The Cartomancer: A Deckbuilding Diviner
158454.description:
From publisher blurb:

Half the fun of a con is the chance of getting caught.

Fate is the both the lawmaker and the policeman of the universe. Responsible for developing simplifying assumptions about each individual under its jurisdiction, Fate defines the beginning, middle, and end of the existence of everything simply because it allows the universe to be more efficient as a whole. Still, in order to maintain this efficiency, Fate has forced itself to be exceptionally literal and open to... creative interpretation.

A select few take the concept of confidence artist and point the con at the universe itself. Their favored word? "Technically..." Their favorite expression? A disarming smile. Their name? Cartomancers. Masters of reading into the web that Fate has woven and pulling out dozens of possible scenarios that technically fulfill its requirements, cartomancers are both wise, for they must know how Fate works, as well as charismatic, for they must be able to get away with the half-lies that they spout. Cartomancers walk the razor's edge, constantly prodding at and manipulating Fate, forcing the cards to fall the way they wish. Does Fate respond? All the time. Cartomancers are used to the backlash, and some of their colleagues have fallen to Fate's particularly vindictive mood swings; most cartomancers simply smile and explain that it's all part of the rush. Half the fun of a con is the chance of getting caught.

The ninth class in Interjection Games' constantly-growing stable of the strange, unusual, and just plain fun, the cartomancer is a deckbuilding base class that is compatible with poker cards, tarot cards, or the print-and-play deck that just so happens to be the last thirteen pages of the book. Each day, cartomancers build an active deck of spells, or portents, from a collection of cards. Based on the concept of breaking luck and effectively rigging the game, the cartomancer's greatest enemy is the luck of the draw. As their hand of cards defines how they can manipulate fate, sometimes they have precisely what is needed to turn a fight their way - more often they don't. As luck is something they are all too familiar with, savvy cartomancers are known to learn seals, or generic manifestations of Fate that are always within arm's reach.

Product Features

Deckbuilding base class with 54 unique portents faithfully based on the major and minor arcana of tarot
Compatible with poker cards and tarot cards
Comes with a complete print-and-play deck, plus a cheat sheet card!
Approximately 25 of the best feats ever put into an Interjection Games class
12 seals, generic manifestations of Fate that allow a cartomancer to use a specific ability regardless of what's in her hand
Rules for fortunetelling and being slapped around by Fate when it's pushed too far

158455.name: Evangelist Kyton
158455.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Evangelist Kyton, better known to most as the Chain Devil. These preachers of pain and violence cross reality, seeking beings to torture and transform into their own at the end of their lashing chains and through their faith in torture.

Includes the evangelist kyton game stats, a brief on the kyton race, and three suggestions on how to include them in your game. There is also a new advantage and a new flaw included.

158456.name: Doppelganger
158456.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Doppelganger, a race of beings that could be from another dimension, space, or somewhere deep in the earth. Consummate manipulators, they change their shape into that of other humanoids to get what they want.

Includes the doppelganger standard game stats, along with suggestions on making this race capable of also copying super-powers, and a template for making player character doppelgangers.

158457.name: Dread Ichor
158457.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Dread Ichor, an incomprehensible ooze that seems to be the manifest essence of evil itself. Able to possess living hosts to get about, slowly rotting them from within, this foul entity is difficult to understand, stop, or contain. Some believe it may even be the source of all evil, or the blood or other remnants of a dead god!

Includes the dread ichor game statistics, typical statistics for a containment canister, and three caper ideas for using this force for Darkness in your game. Also included is a new extra and new flaw.

158458.name: Mi-Go
158458.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the mind of H.P. Lovecraft, this release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Mi-Go, a truly alien form of evolved fungi that have come to Earth to plunder our resources, study us, and eventually colonize our planet. They are master surgeons and engineers of bio-technology who work from the shadows, using the bodies of our own people against us.

Includes game statistics on the mi-go, along with samples of some of their more common technology. Rounding out this product are three caper ideas for using mi-go in your game, including how they may be involved with granting player characters their powers, and 1 new extra and 1 new advantage.

158459.name: Fay'nabolg
158459.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Fay'nabolg as part of our New Camelot mini-series. Once human children, the dark magics of Morgan Le Fay have transformed these innocents into hideously deformed, towering monsters who serve her will.

Includes game statistics for the Deformed and Shapeless variations of fay'nabolg, and three caper ideas for using these corrupted creatures in your game. Also included is a new advantage.

158460.name: Cthulhu
158460.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on Cthulhu, the most famous of the Great Old Ones.

Includes game information on Cthulhu, as well as the Deep Ones race, including two stages of human/deep one hybrids. Rounding out this product are a number caper ideas for using Cthulhu in your game, a new advantage, and the Mental Disorder complication.

158461.name: Sacrificial Pool
158461.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color floorplan of a Sacrificial Pool.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Drown them or else the Water God will take us all in the tsunami of his rage!”

Sacrificial Pool is a single map of a temple built into a hill or mountainside overlooking a beach. The edges of the map have a view of the exterior beach and hill/mountain. The center of the map has a view of the interior of the temple, as it is open topped from above.

Sacrificial Pool is intended for use in fantasy or horror games. It could be used in a modern game as an archaeologist find of an ancient structure as well.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Sacrifice to the False God: Since ancient times, the people of the island have used the sacrificial pool to appease the Water God ever since a terrible tsunami and a flood nearly wiped them out. The Water God was angry so he sent his waves. He demanded blood, the water of man as tribute or he would spread even more death upon the people of the islands.

What they could not possibly know is the Water God was slain by another god who wanted the blood being sacrificed to the Water God. This Blood God had been gathering the yearly blood sacrifices and preparing for his physical entrance into the world. Now is the year of his arrival. When the sacrifice is made this time, the Blood God will form itself from blood using the images of the Water God to maintain its charade (You can see the image of this god on the bottom of the pool and its face on the statues). The Blood God vows it will feed all the time, rather than just once a year.

The Player Characters can get involved by trying to stop the gruesome sacrifice (people are immersed and drowned in the pool alive), or by witnessing the murder of one of the people in town by the Blood God, who literally drains the blood of the victim through its tentacles, leaving a desiccated husk behind. Its up to the group to decide to confront this Blood God about the string of murders or run out of town and leave the people who worship the Blood God to their fate.

158462.name: Rotsystem
158462.description:
User summary:

A Swedish RPG set in a dystopian future. Mankind has retreated into mega cities to escape the vegetation of nature which corrupts and actively works to destroy us.

The setting displays a mix between cyberpunk and a low-tech future since this entity, which communicate via radio waves, hacks into all open systems.

158463.name: More than human
158463.description:
User Summary:

A Swedish superhero RPG with focus on moral and ethic questions rather than the powers themselves.
The players take on the roles of Alfas which in turn are connected to different aspects such as streangth or fire.

The metaplot is set in today's Chicago where an ancient and vile organisation, among others, plot to bring about the end of Alfas everywhere.

158464.name: Shopping Cart Showdown!
158464.description:
Complete grocery shopping lists in this race for the most groceries you can get into your shopping bag, basket or cart. Be quick to finish them before your opponents steal your groceries! Very fast paced game for everyone 8-80 to enjoy.

There are 52 shopping cards with point values from 1 - 8. 68 grocery cards with matching pictures and point values. 4 Robber cards and 2 \"Buy one - Get one\" coupons. The shopping lists are randomly placed in piles of 3,4,5 in front of the players. The storeroom is setup with 2 of each grocery. Players get 5 cards each and one bag, basket and cart to fill. The bag holds max 3 items, the basket 4 and the cart 5. Match the cards in your hand to the shopping lists and collect the points.

You can move one item between bag, basket or cart once per turn. You can discard one card per turn. Lastly, you can go to the storeroom to make one trade per turn. This works with a equal number trade mechanic.

Fill the shopping lists before your opponents to collect the points!

158465.name: Mittelerde Rollenspiel
158465.description:
user summary

German Edition of the English Middle-Earth Role Playing. This is the German Book Version of the first edition rules.
See also the German boxed version:

Mittelerde Rollenspiel Deluxe Edition




And the earlier English versions

Middle-earth Role Playing (1st Edition)
Middle-earth Role Playing (1st Edition, Revised)




The German version of the rules is called MERS (Mittelerde Rollenspiel = Middel-Earth Role Play) and was released November 1987.

158466.name: Captain's Log #37
boardgame: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
158466.description:
Basics: 120 pages, 6 scenarios, 11 new ships.

From the back cover:

Run And Gun: Frigates Rommel and Guderian are covering the gap between the second and third divisions of the Sixth Fleet when a squadron of Romulan raiders tries to break through. The two frigates cannot leave the raiders to attack the supply system, but cannot win against superior numbers and firepower. Their only choise is a running gunfight, delaying the Romulans while they live.

Communications: Command the Future, Conventions & Aces, Star Fleet Awards, After Action Reports, Starline 2004, Input Guide, and Much More!

Federation Commander: New ships, scenarios, tactics and fighters!

New Ships: The WYN Navy steals, borrows and buys eight warship huls. Lyran Heavy Frigate and Heavy Destroyer. Klingon SD7 Strike Cruiser.

Venues: Galactic Conquest, Star Fleet Warlords, SFB (and FC) On-Line & PBEM.

Database: The massive Death Probe is heading for your planet! Stop it!

Tactical Primer: Victory in Space, Term Papers, Omegan Gunboats.

Scenarios: More enemies cross time and space to destroy your empire.

Federation & Empire: Enhanced Small-Scale Combat, the Green Menace.

158467.name: Seaplane Spotter
158467.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a primitive TL4 spotter seaplane, designed to support naval operations.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

158468.name: Dispatches From the Bunker #37
158468.description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader:

4 scenarios, as described by the publisher:

Stossgruppe Schlicter: Nice tourney sized offering from Bruce Childs finds us in Norway 1940 as the German force is trying to remove a roadblock, cause casualties and exit. Quick playing with variable game length. Boards 34 & 37.

Anchoring the Line: The latest RB action from Any Hershey see the Germans on defense on New Years Eve 1942 in the east-central part of the Barricades.
Reinforced infantry companies on both sides as the Russians try to take back buildings from the German defenders. Variable VPs for buildings in the German set up area lead to a guessing game on what they are worth. Nice SSRs spice things up.

LZ S: Mike Puccio's latest look at the Glider attacks into Germany in March '45.

Reinforced company of glider troops with plenty of SWs and some ordnance land around and possibly amidst German artillery positions on Boards 1a, 43 & 44.

Taking out the guns is the goal. Very cool scenario with instant action as the gliders try to land amongst AA fire.

Mawchi Road: A big, large, nasty PTO fight from Joe Gochinski sees Brits of the Royal Berkshire Regiment trying to clear the Mawchi Road at Toungoo, Burma.

Both sides have 3 company sized infantry units that are augmented from a pool of Divisional assets including SMCs/SWs/Ordnance for the IJA and a fleet of various armed carriers for the British. Although a Big Scenario on Boards 50, 63 & q, it plays fairly short due to only being 6.5 turns long and with all that firepower units tend to disappear quickly as well. Killer scenario in every way.

158469.name: Sail Away, Sweet Sister
158469.description:
From the publishers webpage:
Monsters of the Shadows

Thomas McCallister’s area of expertise—the virus that turns metahumans into flesh-eating monsters—has taken him into some dark corners of the Sixth World. When he came face to face with the serial murderer known as the Mealtime Killer, he had hoped that a particularly dark chapter of his life had come to a close. But when night falls in the sprawls of the world, blood is still being shed, and people are still dying. Another killer is still out there, one that needs to be found and stopped, but the challenge McAllister is about to face is one he never could have anticipated. His resolve will be tested in ways he never anticipated in his darkest nightmares.

Sail Away, Sweet Sister builds on the events of Another Rainy Night, taking another dark turn down the streets of the Sixth World to face the monsters that lurk there. Along with a full short story, it contains game statistics for the major characters in the work, as well as spells, gear, and other game information that allows you can drop the people from this story right into your Shadowrun game (stats are included in the PDF version and will be made available as a free PDF that ePub/Kindle buyers can download).

Sail Away, Sweet Sister is dual-statted, meaning it can be used with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition or Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition

158470.name: Dig Down Dwarf: Gems of Norcia!
158470.description:
Gems of Norcia is an optional expansion for Dig Down Dwarf. It adds a catch-up mechanic to the base game. If a player ends a turn without gaining a gem, they get to draw 3 random gems form the "Gems of Norcia!" pouch.

Players gain 4 VP for every set of four different colored gems they draw from this bag over the course of the game.

Contains 20 custom 12 sided gems in four different colors, a grey suede pouch, and instructions.

158471.name: Flip Out (1982)
158471.description:
User Summary

The “board” consists of a series of lanes into which balls are dropped. Flippers spanning two lanes will either hold a ball, if in the upright position, or allow the ball to pass thru, changing the position of the flipper and allowing any held balls to fall.

Each player has ten balls of their own color. Either black or white. Balls passing out the bottom of the board goes to the player of the opposing color. White balls go to the black player and black balls to the white player. The first player to have all ten balls of the opposite color wins.

Their are nine different board layouts that can be played against the computer or another person.

158473.description:
Arkana Miłości: Dominacja (Arcana of Love: Domination) is the second expansion pack for Arkana Miłości (Arcana of Love) card game, but it can also be played separately as a standalone game.

Arkana Miłości is a best-selling exclusive erotic card game for couples, released by a Polish publishing company Let's Play. Its sequel, Domination, introduces 64 new cards illustarted with nude photographs by young Polish artists.

7 types of cards are available:

• ARCANA – they strip you or your lover.
• DARES - they are challenges, which strengthen the bonds of trust.
• ACTIONS – they give you an opportunity to make your erotic fantasies real.
• SPECIAL ACTIONS – they affect the game and make it more dynamic.
• COUNTER ACTIONS – they deny some actions or dares.
• TRUMPS - which remain in the game and add effects which change it.
• TRICKS - which can be used like Actions or make up part of them.

The game ends when at least one person takes off all her/his clothes and the card Arcana of Love: Domination is played; after that the person who loses the game, has to fulfill the winner’s fantasies until the end of the evening.
158473.name: Arkana Miłości: Dominacja

158474.name: AeternoBlade
158474.description:
User Summary

Freyja sets out on a journey to avenge the destruction of her village caused by the demonic Beladim. She confronts him but fails and is teleported back seven days by her time manipulating blade, AeternoBlade, for a second shot at felling the demon.

158476.name: Paku Paku
158476.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Pac-Man.




User SummaryPaku Paku is a text mode clone of Pac-Man. It mimics most every aspect of the original game, with the Paku Paku character moving about a 2D screen, collecting all of the dots and bonuses in the level while avoiding the ghosts. Fruits appear as extra points and the ghosts can be consumed if the powerup has been recently collected as well.

158477.name: Paul's Classroom Math
158477.description:
User Summary

Paul's Classroom Math is a simple math quiz in which the player attempts to answer as many simple math questions as he or she can in the 60 second time period. Points are awarded for the number of questions completed and for accuracy. There are four names to play under, and scores are collected in the high score chart after each quiz round.

158478.name: Die Pyramide des Todes
158478.description:
(From the backcover, translated by User.)

A lost prince,
An insidious intrigue,
A dark power, who is longing for revenge ...

There is turmoil in the normally peaceful sultanate of Daiwaristan, because the only son and heir of the old sultan is missing without a trace. Where could he be? Has he run away? Or is he the victim of a kidnapping? And what about the rumours of a secret liaison of the prince?

All these questions need to be answered, to finally find out, where the prince is: In the realms of the mummy-princes of Shan'Zasar. Therefore, somebody needs to follow the trail of the prince into the realm of the undead, where the gleaming sun is burning down on the barren soil at day, while the bony servants of the mummy-princes roam at night.

But this is just the forerunner of the true horror, who lurk in the dark of the Pyramide of Death - because here, giant beetles, skelettons, undead priests and not least an evil, that had been banished centuries ago, seek out the character's lifes.

"The Pyramide of Death" is a Dungeonslayers adventure for characters from 9th to 12th level. It plays in the sultanate Daiwaristan and the realm of the mummy-princes of Shan'Zasar in the south of the world Caera. Here, tales from 1001 night meet sinister undead, slaves give their lives to build monumental pyramide-fortresses and a deafening noise from the hagglers is echoing on the bazars. Daiwaristan, starting point of the adventure, is covered in detail and can therefore be used even after the events of this adventure as base and haven for adventures in the south of Caera.

158479.name: Der Wind des Wahnsinns
158479.description:
From the backcover, translated by user

Two exciting adventures for characters of levels 1 to 6.

The "Neidhammel"
A feast with old tradition is supposed to be held, but a catastrophy looms, with kidnapping and murder, if the characters don't intervene. The adventure presents a journey full of perils, challanges and a showdown fill of action for characters of levels 1 to 4.

The Wind of Madness
Far in the south, the exotic city of Arrez is falling into madness. The cure for this could lie in the desolate Damorra - the land, where the elements themselve wage war against each other. Do the characters dare to venture there nonetheless and face the perils? Do they find the cause for all the madness and the cure for it? An adventure full of magic, exotic ... and a sheer storm of madness.

158480.name: Seerosen-Treff
158480.description:
By flicking Frog-chips using a magnetic device, 2-4 players try to hit the water lily leaves on the board to score victory points.

German description from the publisher:
Der Frosch fühlt sich recht unwohl an Land und ist deshalb gerne an seinem Lieblingsteich. Dort kann er es sich auf einem der vielen Seerosenblätter so richtig gemütlich machen. Lediglich das Erreichen dieser stellt eine Herausforderung dar. Denn aufgepasst! Landet der Frosch nach einem Sprung im Wasser oder gar auf dem Rücken, so muss er schnell zurück ans Ufer schwimmen und hat leider keine Möglichkeit, sich auszuruhen. Für genügend Sprungkraft sorgen zwei sich abstoßende Magnete - einer im Startblock und ein weiterer in der Froschfigur. Wer schafft es, den Frosch geschickt und mit genügend Zielgenauigkeit am besten hüpfen zu lassen?

158481.name: Der Rostige Pfad Gottes
158481.description:
(User summary)
First adventure for Gammaslayers, the post-apocalyptic version of the roleplaying game Dungeonslayers. It is written for characters from levels 4 to 8. The main adventure plays in the region of Mittland around the present-day city of Kassel. Furthermore, the book includes over 30 additional scenario hooks, 16 new critters and background information for various themes concerning the area of play.

158482.name: Wyndland: Der Ruf der Wölfe
158482.description:
(User summary)

Sourcebook for the region of Wyndland in the world of Caera. First book in the "Fanwerk"-series, whose books originate from the works of fans which later become printed.

158483.name: Wild-West
158483.description: The goal of the game is to capture the opponent miniatures (cowboys or indians). The players start with 6 figures from their camp. They can set up barriers on certain marked spaces to hinder the movement of their opponents. Figures are captured, if an opponent figure gets on the same space. Captured figures are imprisoned in the camp of the capturer. They may be freed if a figure of their color reaches this camp. The winner is the player who has captured the most opponents when when the first player has lost all his figures (short version) or the player who captures the last remaining opponent (long version).

158486.description:
Blankety Blank is based on the UK BBC TV quiz show of the same name first introduced by Terry Wogan in 1977, itself based on the 1970's version of the US Game Show MATCH GAME.

The game involves guessing the missing "blank" in a sentence. The sentence itself often gives an innocuous clue to the blank. Players then compare answers and score points for matching answers.

One player acts as quizmaster and the other players take turns to be a "contestant" and a "panelist." The quizmaster decides who the first contestant is going to be the first question is read out and the contestant and panelists write their answers on the sheet provided.

When everyone has recorded their answer, the contestant reads out his answer first, followed by each panelist in turn. Each time that the answer of the contestant matches that of the panelist the contestant gets a point.

The two contestants with the highest number of points then go on to play the "Super Match Game." In this game there are three possible answers to each question--the answers are worth 50 points, 100 points or 150 points. When a player matches any of these answers, they record the number of points won. The player with the most points at the end of the Super Match is the winner and goes on to the Head to Head game, the last round.

Blankety Blank: Travel allows 3-9 players where the base game allows 3-6, and may be played alone or with the base game.
158486.name: Blankety Blank: Travel

158487.description:
Dragon Tides emphasizes non-linear play, with your decisions during narrative or from the success or defeat from a scene guides you to the next location and part of the story. Each scene has different objectives for both the heroes and the Tiger Organization making the game more than just a beat-em-up. Components include six double-sided hex maps that are interchanged based on the scene setup; miniatures of Bruce Lee, Brandon Lee, Viktoria Jovovich, Luke Elba, and the four bosses/sub-bosses; ten Action Dice; six Player Boards; Henchmen and item tokens; Signature Move Cards and Attack Cards specific for each character; and health counters.

Designed by Kevin G. Nunn and Luther Bell Hendricks V (Sentinel Tactics, Schlock Mercenaries), Dragon Tides is a story-driven, semi co-op game using custom dice to evoke the feeling of martial arts action/adventure as well as a card element that focuses on how well you read your opponents. Each character has a unique set of signature moves that showcase their personal techniques. Dragon Tides introduces a unique cast of characters that are iconic to the Action genre, creating the roster for the Tiger Organization. The highly detailed Miniature figures are sculpted by Greenbrier Games, LLC.
158487.name: Dragon Tides
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 13 - Techno Bowl Review And Brent Spivey Interview

158488.name: Meet the Missus at the Broadcast
158488.description:
"An exciting radio 'quiz' game for all the family!"

One of a series of games based on an early audience-participation radio show. "Meet the Missus at the Broadcast" (1940) is a parchesi game with quiz questions thrown in. Gameboards were printed on heavy paper and measure 18" square when unfolded. Game instructions printed on the back of the mailing envelope. Fitzpatrick Brothers Inc. (out of Chicago) were the radio show sponsor. Their products included "Kitchen Klenzer Automatic Soap Flakes" and "Big Jack Laundry Soap"

158489.description:
From the publisher:

This extension to Snowdonia contains 99 cards on which a total of four scenarios can be found:

Jungfrau Railway
Bavarian Zugspitze Railway
Mt Washington
Britannia Bridge

---
From the publisher:

Diese Erweiterung zu Snowdonia enthält 99 Karten, auf denen insgesamt 4 Szenarien zu finden sind:

Jungfraubahn
Bayerische Zugspitzbahn
Mt. Washington
Britannia Bridge
---

This German expansion pack for Snowdonia by Lookout Games came without a box and without a rulebook. It is given out in three shrink-wrapped card packages with 33 cards each.

Snowdonia: Bayerische Zugspitzbahn develops the importance of the Surveyor for work (building, excavating and track laying), uses a more benevolent version of Snow as weather and even has a Cable Car to get to the Zugspitze Summit.

Snowdonia: Britannia Bridge includes a trio of tweaked contract cards and a new engine – The Dawn Raider – that allows its owner to build track instead of the game (if he wants) whenever the game would build track due to an event.

Snowdonia: Jungfraubahn & Mount Washington has new mechanisms for the use of dynamite, new weather (snow), and new trains combine to provide a different playing experience. Jungfraubahn is a scenario for up to four players, with the yellow fifth player pieces being used as dynamite; the Mount Washington scenario handles up to five players with a new take on the "Surveyor". It is comprised of a rulebook and a single deck of 66 cards containing:


New copies/versions of standard Snowdonia Contract Cards
Alternative versions of Contract cards for the Jungfraubahn scenario
Alternative versions of Contract cards for the Mount Washington scenario
Four new Trains (including Old Peppersass)
Special Jungfrau Track cards
158489.name: Snowdonia: Erweiterung
